review: Overall, I enjoy this app. I‚Äôve been on here since the fall of 2018, I‚Äôm a loyal user. However, recently this app was not working properly for me because I was unable to see the instagram icon on other accounts that I follow and have known in the past that the instagram icon was on their profile. And even after updating this app to the most current version, this problem was still not resolved. I went to the settings in the app and looked up in their report a problem section to see if there was anything I could do about this glitch, and it told me I had to uninstall and reinstall the app to fix any possible issues, so I did. But what it didn‚Äôt tell me is that I would lose my drafts I created. So, I basically lost all my videos I was making progress on and editing because of an issue I did not cause myself. Totally unfair! I created those drafts for a reason and logging out or reinstalling the app shouldn‚Äôt just get rid of the videos I created and saved to my drafts on my account! Nobody should have to lose what may be minutes or hours spent on creating content for their followers all because they temporarily logged out, ridiculous. At least I‚Äôm able to see the instagram icon now, but at what cost...Tiktok, fix this.
title: Great app, but beware of losing your drafts

review: This app is amazing! It is a great way to cure boredom, though it is hard to stop scrolling. I love how there are settings to make sure children see appropriate content, but can still enjoy the app. There is only one thing I would like to be added that I have wanted multiple times. Let me explain. When you make a TikTok you can sort it into what I call ‚Äúfolders‚Äù (I don‚Äôt know what they are actually called). People can see that the video is in a folder, and can open the folder to see more videos that are in the same category as that one. If you already have the app you should know what I‚Äôm talking about. Anyways, I have found myself wishing, multiple times, that you could follow a folder to see the content you saw and liked in the folder, and not have to follow the account. I think this would be great because sometimes you want to see certain content from a person but they don‚Äôt always post only that content. For example, if I find a person that makes videos doing pranks I like and I want to see more of those pranks, it would be nice to be able to follow a folder where they do only pranks instead of having to follow the account, since then you would be seeing more than just their pranks. I‚Äôm sorry if any of that was confusing. I tried my best to say what I was thinking. I think this feature would be nice so people could see more of the content they like. Otherwise this is an amazing app I am glad to have. Thank you for taking the time to read this!
title: Review

review: I got Tiktok during the pandemic last year. I loved everything about it and how it brought a lot of people together and the fun dance challenges you could do. My only issue is I found a lot of my videos on this foreign website called urlebird. I was shocked to see my videos along with millions of others that got their videos stolen. It really broke my heart to see kids under the age of 13 and their videos were on this website. The way it works is you go to the search button on the front page and look for users on the site and see their videos. I was able to get them to take my videos down but it was already to late. My videos had been shared everywhere as it shows how many times your videos are downloaded, comments and etc. later that same week my Instagram got hacked. I had millions of porn accounts on my Instagram and I couldn‚Äôt do anything to stop it. I had to get rid of my Instagram and start over. Again I got hacked. The same stuff. I just want to warn others of this issue because this website still exist and has caused many people like myself to get hacked because of this site stealing innocent peoples videos. There is a petition to get the site taken down and I encourage everyone to sign it. 1 way you can do to possibly stop your videos from getting on this disgusting website is to make your account private. I hope this helps and safes a lot of people from this website stealing videos and hacking their accounts. God bless everyone üíó
title: Great app but beware

review: I like this app, but there's a couple of things I wish could be fixed and added to it. Firstly, I used to be able to just swipe my screen to switch to the for you page and following, but I can't anymore. It was a convenient feature and I miss it. Secondly, I love the favorites feature. I like to put videos in there to watch later. But I have way too many of them and all of the videos relate to different things, so when I want to find a specific video in my favorites it can get irritating. I wish there was a way to organize them better, maybe like making playlist sort of things. It'd be much easier to look for them. Thirdly, I hear creators talk about how some of the filters dramatically changes their face. I saw that even just recording a video without a filter does that. Like for example, it makes your face look a lot slimmer and tints your lips or changes your eye color without even using a filter. It can also smoothen your skin or make you lighter. Some of the creators can't even turn this off. I think this is an issue because 1, you can't turn these filters off. 2, it can make people feel worse about themselves. It tries to "fix" things that are completely normal about your appearance when none of it needs to be fixed. It can make people feel more insecure about themselves. Other than all of that, I like using Tiktok. There's just some things I don't like about it.
title: Some complaints and suggestions

review: I absolutely love tiktok and the platform is gives to people, but it needs more regulation. There‚Äôs too many children on this app when it‚Äôs 12+ and they‚Äôre being raised by influencers who post raunchy videos. Also, there are constant reposts of videos of death, self harm, and child nudity. I don‚Äôt know about you guys, but I would not like to open my app to become a sex offender or traumatized. Another thing is the filters; I understand that people use them to feel better by using some face changing stuff, but there should always be an option where you can tap to only have the effects without added makeup. There‚Äôs one filter that‚Äôs been a trend where someone can morph their face from an old picture, but it puts makeup on the live one?? Are you guys trying to market a generation of people even more insecure than everything else they‚Äôre vulnerable to? I understand that running an app with an abundance of users is difficult, but i don‚Äôt understand how a video with a cuss word gets banned before a video with genuinely illegal content does. And as a whole, the filters being put out are much easier to regulate than user content. These are issues constantly being brought up on the platform and I‚Äôm simply voicing it in the reviews section but please do better for the youth and young adults alike. This is an influential app for the new generation, and it needs more effort put forth for its users. More empathy.
title: New Age Social Media

review: For all of the hype that surrounds TikTok, it is an incredibly interesting app that plays a major role in the life of most adolescents today. It can create unique spaces of community on the app, and provide content for people to talk about, share, and bond over outside the app itself. However, from my own experience, I would rate the app a 3 out of 5. The fact that the For You page provides a constant stream of new content is a brilliant design choice to get people to spend longer on the app, it can often feel like the user does not have agency over what they are seeing. Additionally, fears about being on a different ‚Äòside‚Äô of TikTok than peers could be a source of stress or concern for some adolescents, adding to potential mental health effects social media can have. Most of the design of the app is intuitive once the user has been on it for a little bit, and while the privacy settings are not front-and-center, they are available so that adolescents can have the content that they view tailored somewhat to not include inappropriate content and to promote healthy app usage, but allowing a parent to have potential control over being able to extend time using the app must feel like an invasion of their privacy. However, without an external source of monitoring, it can be very easy for adolescents, as well as adults, to become compulsive TikTok users who only find sporadic joy from the content they watch.
title: Social Work student here!

review: I‚Äôve had this app since late 2018 and over these 3 years I‚Äôve become a part of this huge community of cosplayers and people a part of the lgbtq+ community. There are so many great people on this app and so many that basically are role models for the communities and are people to look up to. On the other hand, I feel that there isn‚Äôt nearly enough enforcement against cyber bullying. Especially with anti-trans people. I‚Äôve seen so many death threats, so many awful comments to give people dysphoria, and just downright trying to belittle anyone that is openly a part of either of these communities. And over half the time these comments are never taken down from reports and there‚Äôs no action against these people‚Äôs accounts where their main goal is just to harass both people of the lgtbq+ community or people showing their creativity through cosplay, fursuits, anime, anything revolving around that. This app is meant to just have fun and create a sense of community yet this issue has continued to ruin our experience. If anything this issue has worsened over the years and have caused so many people to stop doing what they love. It has made it much more harder than it already is for people to come out openly about their sexuality. As there is a great community on this app, I just wish that this issue is taken more seriously as it has a very large impact on a lot of people.
title: Great Cosplay & LGBTQ+ communities, but awful cyber bullying

review:
4/5
My tiktok experience has been the best! I‚Äôve gotten no hate but it is still possible! So be aware, however it is a really fun app to make videos, react to videos, and find your favorite creators to follow! There are live streams that you get alerted when someone your following goes online. There is also a following page where you can scroll through videos of only the people you follow! There is also a for you page that allows you to fine new creators and great content! Time passes by QUICK with this app so be careful! Remember to stay healthy while on this app! You can also search for certain accounts to follow, certain hashtags, videos, users, sounds, and other things in the search bar! It is a super great and fun app that can also be educational, I seriously recommend getting it! 4/5 star rating! 

I have one recommendation for an update! Maybe adding a certain option to only update videos to a certain gender of viewers could be helpful! Like for example, videos about women puberty tips could be a helpful reason to make it only for women. Adding a video about this on a man/boy‚Äôs for you page is not exactly appealing to them. This can also be vice versa. Just a small recommendation for the viewers possible safety and entertainment!
title: It‚Äôs amazing! But needs some updates

review: This app will always have a place in my heart it has helped me through some tough times. Getting on this app everyday and seeing my favorite creator will always make my day. Even when I myself started making content and gained over 400k followers, the love I was getting everyday helped me through a lot of problems that I was facing. I have no idea what is going on. My friends and their friends are getting temporarily banned from posting and some of them have even gotten banned. TikTok has taken down videos that I have had up for a long time, then take it down for a reason that has nothing to do with the video. I make the same content that I have been making since March of 2020 why are my videos just now are being taken down it is very stressful. I have also deleted every video on my TikTok that I feel will violate their community guidelines so that my chances of getting banned are low. I just hope that TikTok sees this review and do something about it because it must have got to be a system problem because it has never done this before. I can see if I posted very inappropriate content then the videos I post get taken down but I post the same content that I have always been posting. So TikTok just please do something about this because it is so draining to the people who is actually committed to the app. Thank You- dedicatedcobie (<TikTok)
title: People are getting banned for no reason‚Ä¶..

review: I enjoy using TikTok I‚Äôm already at 4K and it is fun to use but the issue is and Ik it may be a need sometimes but I want unfollowing to not be a thing anymore it takes away a lot of confidence for me to be able to make videos and I‚Äôm being unfollowed for no reason even if I post or if I say I‚Äôm taking a break and when I say I‚Äôm taking a break bc somethings going on I‚Äôm being serious and people unfollowing me for it makes me feel like they don‚Äôt care that something‚Äôs going on.I am really tired of it and it makes me feel like I‚Äôm not good enough anymore and if I lose enough confidence I‚Äôll end up not being able to make videos for other people anymore. I don‚Äôt even make offensive videos or anything I hate it when I reload my page my followers went down once or twice and there isn‚Äôt even a reason why I need to be unfollowed and it does honestly make me upset I really hope it‚Äôll stop being a thing I like entertaining people but if they keep unfollowing it‚Äôll take away confidence and there won‚Äôt be anything new on my page. :/ but otherwise fun to use I would recommend getting if you are bored but beware time flies by really fast when using so if you have somewhere to go I would be careful lol üòÖ.
title: Great app but I have a suggestion/issue

review: Honestly I like this platform a lot. If it weren't for a few things I would give it 5 stars... firstly, it's the newest of the popular social media platforms in America. It's a lot easier to get likes, follows, and views due to there not being as many creators. Because of this, going viral isn't as hard and it's a great tool for a lot of aspiring artists, musicians, comedians, and content creators which is why I love it so much. Also a great resource for people who need help or want to make extra money. However, I do not like the fact that TikTok chooses to shadow ban creators they don't personally agree with (it even made me unfollow some creators without me ever pressing the "unfollow" button and did not notify me at all), yet they let actual offensive content stay up (jokes/videos about rape/sexual assault, racism, misogyny, homophobia, etc). It's biased and unjust, I feel guilt sometimes for supporting this app. I might not be able to use it any longer if this continues. Also, you should be able to comment many more characters, it's limiting our ability to speak up for what's right. It's also very frustrating & annoying. Lastly, you really should be paying you're creators a lot more. Especially since you make so much on ads. They deserve a bigger cut of the money for the hard work they put in. I really do love Tiktok and I want to keep using it so please fix these issues... thanks.
title: Entertaining but Corrupt

review:
Okay, here‚Äôs my review. This APP IS WONDERFUL. But there are some down sides to it. So, I deleted this app once but I wanted it back so I can use it on my spare time. Anyways, my second ‚Äúbut‚Äù is that even if you don‚Äôt want an account and your trust trying out the app, don‚Äôt pull up the pop-up that says ‚ÄúSIGN UP‚Äù or ‚ÄúLOGIN IN‚Äù. review: I‚Äôve had tik tok for over a year now and have racked up a good amount of accounts I follow. I hardly ever get notifications for the accounts I want to stay in touch with. I suggest making push notifications more customizable as in being able to get all new video notifications from certain accounts. This would also help content creators as well because it would allow their content to be seen more. We are all struggling in this pandemic and I feel this would be a great help for smaller creators in the creator fund. Another problem is how you enforce your rules. I‚Äôve seen countless high follower count, young, fit women showing off more than what should be shown, as there are children on this app, while smaller creators are having their videos taken down with showing less than what the more popular creators are showing off. It is completely unfair and unjust. On one of the pages I follow, one of their videos was taken down for nudity, with showing an appropriate one-piece swimsuit, while there are other videos with much more shown off are still up. If you are going to be strict about the rules at least apply them to ALL creators and not just the smaller creators please.
title: Unfair enforcement of rules and notification suggestion

review: This might sound silly but the FYP really is for YOU. Once I realized I was in a bad headspace and started working on myself as a person all together, I got on positive side of tiktok. So many down to earth people making content that not only helps me but others. So many comments ‚ÄúI needed this today‚Äù I know most people see tiktok as some dancing joking app but it genuinely has helped me feel less alone, gave me more ideas to further myself mentally, emotionally, spiritually. I feel more in touch with my true self than I ever have and I am honestly so grateful for this platform. The fact I am able to see every day people just like me talk about their vulnerable moments and that I am able to share content that I create. Yes it can be hard sometimes to get off the app because there is so much content that is wonderful to see but I believe there is an option to put a limit for yourself so you don‚Äôt spend too much of your day on here. I never thought I‚Äôd be writing a review for any app but I really do wanna put it out there this app is not just for jokes or dancing, although if you‚Äôre interested in that stuff I‚Äôm positive it‚Äôs on there for you. There‚Äôs something for everyone on Tiktok regardless of who you are.
title: Honestly helped my mental health

review: I discovered TikTok during quarantine‚Ä¶. At first I watched ‚Äúfunny videos‚Äù about puppies. But it very quickly became a tool to learn. Political events, BLM, covid etc. I feel like it was the first time I could understand and see what people were actually going through. It helped me navigate my emotions and figure out how I could contribute to the world‚Ä¶ our country‚Ä¶. My neighbors. It‚Äôs taught me what truth looks like and how untruthful the powers that be are. My grout lines are immaculate, I fixed my dryer, learned a ton of new recipes,learned that I‚Äôm not the only one fascinated with zit popping. I watched soooo many people become their creative selves, become stronger, teach and most importantly grow. I believe that TikTok has created a true sense of community‚Ä¶.at least the start of one. I‚Äôm still bothered that the mediators take down content from creators simply because haters report it. There has got to be a better way for you guys to see what true bullying is. Please don‚Äôt silence the people that are trying to make the world better, educate us and respectfully show us our truth‚Ä¶.science based truth‚Ä¶. Historical truth‚Ä¶. Social truth. They are the ones that will make this world a better place for all of us‚Ä¶. And the earth. I am so thankful for the platform.‚ù§Ô∏èüåûüåé

review:
I think TikTok is a great app to be honest! It has help me grow in all kinds of different ways and is kind of addicting in a good way. However, I feel like there is more that TikTok could do to improve the app. For example, you should be able to see who duets a video. I feel like it would be easier if we want to see other people‚Äôs reactions and want to share that as well. I also feel like we should be able to have a story that is up for 24 hours so we don‚Äôt have to make videos about something we want to share that is really not that important. In addition to that, we should be able to repost videos on our story as well. I saw a really REALLY good danganronpa edit and it was SUPER underrated but I couldn‚Äôt share it with anyone because when I duetted it, it only got 2 views in a day. Also, I think we should be able to go live (like a FaceTime on live) with other people. It would be super fun! We used to have a feature where we could pin comments, but we can‚Äôt do that anymore? Which is kind of disappointing, but if you can do that again, it would be great! We should also be able to pin videos incase someone is new to an account and people want to introduce themselves. 

Anyway, I think that‚Äôs about all I wanted to share to help TikTok grow as a community and app.
title: Great App but...

review: i LOVE tik tok so much. i think i speak for most of the population when i say that basically all i do during quarantine is make and watch tik tok. however, there are a few suggestions that i have. my first would be that there should be a dislike button on videos. a lot of the time if there is a controversial video people have to like it to save it which gives that creator more clout. if you put a dislike button, it shows the creator how many people he/she truly upset. i understand why that could be a bad thing but maybe try it and take it away if it gets too bad? this next suggestion is one that i have thought of since i got the app. when i really like a video, want to recreate it, show it to my friends, watch later, etc. i put the video into my favorites. however, i now have so many videos in my favorites that i can‚Äôt even find the video i need at the time. for this issue, i wish so deeply that the favorites section had different folders that you could name. this way, when you go to put the video in your favorites it asks which folder, you could name a folder, watch later, dances, show to people, etc. tik tok is a great app but please please please take my last idea into consideration.

title: Amazing

title: Eye opening ‚ù§Ô∏è

review: TikTok is a fun app to watch dancing, comedy, cooking, hacks and many more videos. I would 10/10 recommend getting it if you haven‚Äôt already. If you are a parent figuring out if your child should be able to get TikTok just know that some songs and some dances are a little inappropriate for the younger kids. If your child is 11+ I would say they will be fine. The app itself is organized very well, so you save videos and sounds to look at later. You are allowed to have a private or public account depending where n your comfort. A private account means that you have to send a request to follow the user. This also means that you have to follow the user in order to watch their videos. Having a public account means anybody can follow you and anybody can sit and scroll through your account. You can remove followers. When having a public account, your videos may also be on the for you page. The for you page is videos you can scroll through of content that is recommended for you based on what you like and save. This is how many videos go viral. So an overall rating on this app, 10/10 would recommended, it keeps you busy all day and there is a video out there that will make you laugh.

review: I‚Äôm a teenager who got tiktok and honestly, I don‚Äôt regret it. Originally I didn‚Äôt want tiktok because it was so overrated, but with so many people using it I decided to give it a try, I have got to say, i made the right choice. I have a LOT of social media, and they don‚Äôt even compare. There is so much you can do on tiktok, and it‚Äôs actually very easy to get famous compared to other social media‚Äôs, because everyone has equal opportunities. Aside from that, when tiktok says trends start here, I used to just roll my eyes, but now I literally see that around 80% of the trends I see are based on tiktok. Anything can go viral there in less than an hour. About age limits, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this app for anyone under 12, because it does have cursing, and content that is not appropriate for younger audiences, however, if it is a parent managed account, parents are able to control what their child watches, what their child posts, they can make the account private, so that only friends can see their posts, and they can even block curse words. If you are thinking about getting tiktok, whether you are a kid, teen, or parent, just do it, and if you don‚Äôt like what you see, you can always take it off.
title: Best app ever!

review:
Now I‚Äôll have to give it to TikTok it is a well made platform with many great creators and a bunch amazing qualities, but at the same time it feels like gambling of the media world. Now with most other platforms there is more choice in what you watch and consume but on TikTok there‚Äôs no filter, you watch what it points in front of you. And the vast majority of the creators, or should I say people who have posted some on TikTok, have no intentions of creating a actual good video. They are there to post something and get views. More then less the videos on TikTok are just to waist your time and try to pander to their audience and not make a good or worthwhile video. With that being said this goes nothing against the TikTok platform, I think TikTok was a great idea yet the publicity of it made it a place for people to search for stardom in their own way, since the bases of the TikTok platform can promote this single video that is bad quality with no reason to exist to million of views and likes. Now also TikTok is extremely addicting to a point where it is unhealthy. It‚Äôs strategy is for you when you are bored to open up and watch 1 or 2 videos but then you go down a long route of watching hundreds of videos and you spend hours of your life. My advice. Don‚Äôt get it, and watch a different platform.
Thank you
title: Don‚Äôt waist your time

review: I‚Äôd give this five stars but like every app there are a few flaws. For example the reporting system was designed to report children and not adults, I‚Äôve seen adults get banned for minor safety. Personally I don‚Äôt get that since their not minors. Then there‚Äôs the new restrictions with minors, minors no longer can duet, comment, or stitch other  posts, meaning that if there was a Tiktoker that was a minor they no longer can show appreciation. Tiktok forced minors to go private for our ‚Äúsafety‚Äù, Tiktok if you cared for our safety you would‚Äôve banned the adults that were showing off their private parts, let me say that again adults showing their privates. Adults also turned the app 18+ this app was designed for kids. Not adults, I‚Äôm not saying if your an adult you can‚Äôt have the app, but please remember there are children on the app. I‚Äôve seen four year olds on there, please be mindful of this. Even with your ‚Äúwarning 18+‚Äù they are children filled with curiosity meaning that they will disregard that warning. I‚Äôve seen 7-11 kids post ‚Äúthirst traps‚Äù and comment on ‚Äúthirst traps‚Äù I find this disgusting. That‚Äôs the parents fault but it‚Äôs also the reporting system because I‚Äôve seen countless posts stay up after 10 people said they reported it. title: I wish I could have people duet me.

review: Hi, first I just wanted to say that I absolutely LOVE TikTok and use the app on a daily basis, but I have noticed a few things that bother me. The first thing is when you are uploading a video, you can‚Äôt save videos,sounds,etc. This bugs me because there a several times I‚Äôm on the For You Page and I want to save a video or sound, but I can‚Äôt because I‚Äôm uploading a video, and then I will accidentally lose the video or sound and not be able to get it back. The next thing is I only ever see people with 1.5k or more likes on my For You Page, and I would appreciate it very much if it were easier for smaller accounts to get views, because most of the time the smaller accounts work just as hard as the larger ones. The last thing is about the comments. I wish people couldn‚Äôt limit the comment section to only ONE person. I understand if it is limited where only friends can comment or if nobody could comment, but I feel like limiting the comment section to only one person could make people feel not welcome and it is a big waste of a comment section. Thank you for making it this far in my review. Once again, I LOVE TikTok but these are just some small things I don‚Äôt love.
title: Love the app, but....

review: Amazing app for so many things. But beyond the obvious entertainment aspect of it, it gives the user a sense of community support. Feeling connected. supporting each other. Making friends. And also it gives the user tools to be able to create and design , as well as star in their own content that is seen by up to millions of people potentially. This app is also getting families a chance to be involved in something together. Especially in a time like 2020 (to current day) and quarantine happened, people moved 6 ft apart but because of TikTok we remained connected. And in the case of the family at home during quarantine, TikTok made a way for families to grow closer, engage in fun challenges and videos together. To learn more about each other, grow deeper connections and have fun together. Also, this app has helped people feeling down, alone, and possibly having self harm ideation, to find comfort in other on the platform. To find others who have felt or feel the same way. TikTok gives opportunities to those to find support or comfort or laughter in what it is they are seeking. I believe TikTok is amazing. I just began using a few weeks ago and I am amazed. I am also. It being paid to say this.
title: Amazing

review:
TikTok is a great app, but I feel like it would be even better if viewers like me and everyone else who likes to from time to time watch some Tik Toks in a short period of time. For instance: you would like to show a friend something funny that you watched in a Tik Tok, ...unfortunately it was at the end of the video. So now you have to wait to show them the absolute comedy gold. At first that doesn‚Äôt seem so bad does it. Although  something to take in to consideration is that not everybody has time to watch all of a video just to get to the good part. That‚Äôs where my idea comes into play. I think that TikTok  should make a feature that includes fast forwarding and reversing the video to the exact point you want it at. 
   Otherwise I love this app. It is a way to be yourself and be creative in your own way. If you don‚Äôt want to do that, it‚Äôs also a good to pass time or just have a few laughs. Better yet it‚Äôs a way to find common ground with other people who like similar stuff that you do. 
   I personally like it a lot, but I know some don‚Äôt. And that‚Äôs ok with me. And if you decide you like it too. I‚Äôll also be thrilled. In the end it‚Äôs you opinion of the app. This is only what I think of it. So what I am trying to say is I like, but don‚Äôt feel like you have too.
title: TikTok

review: I have had musically since the app launched and i can honestly say, it was great at first but slowly got really horrible and a toxic community. I cannot use my wifi while on tiktok, i have to use my LTE data. I have tried everything but it simply will not work. Instead of taking down cosplayers sfx make up videos !that have trigger warnings! Down, take down the bullying accounts and sexual pages that have been up for years. I get that the app is meant for 14+ but there are still underage kids on the app that report videos for no reason, or simply because they got offended by the video that had a warning on it. Instead of taking down the video, actually veiw it, then take it down if it doesn't follow community guide lines. Don't take down a video just because a 6-9 yr. old reported it because their parents said not to watch it. They clearly got angry because their parents got on to them. I'm a cosplayer and am personally sick and tired of the youth on the app that report the lgbtq+, cosplay, gamer, etc. videos just because they did not like it. I hope that tiktok actually takes the time to read the reveiws and try to improve the app. I am very dissapointed in how this community has grown. review: TikTok is a fun app for teens and some adults. There are cool trends to follow, fun hacks, DIYS, cooking/baking, technology, dance, etc. It has taught me a lot of very useful things, and has brought a lot of joy and entertainment. However, there are some cons to TikTok. First of all, it takes up a lot of your storage. I would suggest making it so the videos don‚Äôt save to your camera roll. Second of all, it takes up your battery very quickly. Third of all, it is very distracting and not so good to be on all day. Fourth of all, it is not included on the App Store for MacBooks which is frustrating because I need it considering my phone might break and I like to post daily or once every two days. Fifth of all there‚Äôs quite a bit of inappropriate content around the app, and Finally, there‚Äôs a ton of negativity circulating on the app. Which is shocking considering we are all isolated during a worldwide pandemic when we all need a lot of love and support. One thing I do like though is the other side of the people who stand up against the horrendous hate and negativity, and trust me I‚Äôve seen horrendous things. So all of those cons just take away one star, because other than that, TikTok is super fun, and somewhat educational.
title: Overall

review: The people on here are so toxic! Every time I comment my opinion I get attacked and it RUINS my day! Not even gonna MENTION the creeps on here! I‚Äôm not an angry mom or karen, but I think if something is innapropriate on there, it should be taken down IMMEDIATLY. I‚Äôve made A LOT of reports, and only ONE of them got accepted. I‚Äôve reported someone who told another to KILL THEIRSELVES and the victim that got told to almost DID! If something looks fishy, then I suggest to take down that account and ban them temporarily. Also, PEREZ HILTON SHOULD BE BANNED!! IDK WHY HES NOT! He litterally wants teens off this app, but the app was MADE FOR TEENS, adults and five year olds just snuck on there. I get like 10+, because that‚Äôs the time they start learning, and have health class, but 9- SHOULD NOT, I repeat, SHOULD NOT BE ON TIKTOK WITHOUT A PRIVATE ACCOUNT. My sister is seven years old, and she‚Äôs on private, no trouble, but there‚Äôs some FIVE YEAR OLDS on here, that don‚Äôt have restriction to any nudity or innapropriate stuff, then they think it‚Äôs okay to make. The parents find out and blame you, that could get you POSSIBLY SUED! This isn‚Äôt a safe app for kids 9-. On the bright side, if there‚Äôs a vid that says, ‚ÄúOpinions are available here, no fighting,‚Äù I love it. Healthy and strong opinions with no arguments within it. This app is very fun and addicting, but there‚Äôs some things to change!
title: The bad side is what makes it horrible.

review: I LOVE TikTok! It made me have better relationships with my friends and it genuinely helped me become a more confident person. But over the past few months things have started to change, and not in a good way. TikTok has stopped put Lgbtq+ and comedy videos on the FYP. (People call this ‚Äúshadow banning‚Äù) Instead of funny videos and videos that make me smile, I find myself feeling trapped on TikTok. I use TikTok to express myself and have a laugh once in a while, but now all I see is politics and inappropriate dancing. There are only a few good videos and everyone hates on them. I miss old TikTok, where if I was sad I could feel happy. If I was insecure, I would learn that I wasn't alone. And I know its great to spread awareness and share the news, but I‚Äôm always getting in arguments over who‚Äôs political views are correct. This app is mean‚Äôt for children and teens. It‚Äôs supposed teach you how to spread positivity. Most if the time I learn about dangers in the world faster than my parents. Most if the people on this app are too young to be into politics, including me. (I am 13) And yes, we should know whats going in the world, but not nearly half of the things shown on the FYP (For you page). I loved this app, but I‚Äôm starting to drift away because of its new content.
title: Great app but alot has changed..

review: I love TikTok. I personally use TikTok to have something to do and talk about to my friends. It‚Äôs basically all we do, sometimes it gets out of control and we start making TikToks in the gym of our school during lunch when we can get suspended, but, you gotta do what you gotta do for TikTok. Usually people are really nice and supportive but people can get out of hand with shaming people as a joke when it‚Äôs really not funny at all, I‚Äôve even caught myself hating it just comes and goes and I try to stay away from it. TikTok is my most used app and I have 30+ hours on it every week and idek how. There are a few things I would change and it would be that you can have more control who views your videos. I still want my friends and the public to be able to see my videos but also I want to be able to block a specific person from just one video instead of blocking them from my Paige. That would make you feel a lot more comfortable with posting because I‚Äôm not the most popular kid in my school and there are kids out there just trying to put you down for fun. But overall great app and I give it a whopping 5 stars even tho there are a few small problems. :)
title: Best social media platform ever!

review: It‚Äôs really fun I‚Äôve been on it for almost 1 year, there‚Äôs really inspiring creators on TikTok. But watch out for scammer profiles. But there some mean people too, but there‚Äôs people everywhere so. That‚Äôs basically it of what need to watch out for. I would highly recommend getting TikTok. It‚Äôs a really fun app. And also you have the option to turn off the comments or duet/react and you also can set your account to private or public. And make sure to report scammers if you see any it will really help TikTok fill with more safety and if you see people bully other people please report them too, it really helps TikToks positivity. So when you go to create your first TikTok you can choose all different sounds even make your own. Make to look at the trends to on there. There‚Äôs a new challenge everyday. There‚Äôs also filters and face filters that you can choose from too. You can also look at the ‚Äúfor you page‚Äù and the following page (only people you follow are on there). And if your account is private, people can send you follow requests you can either approve the follow request or disapprove the follow requests. My account is private I only accept the people I know. That‚Äôs basically a summary of the app.
title: Awesome

review:
I love Tik Tok, and I‚Äôve only had it for a few months. It is a great place for me to cosplay, the community is friendly and supportive, and I can do more than take photos now when I‚Äôm in cosplay.  However, the past month and a half every time I try to post my videos go immediately ‚Äúunder review‚Äù and some stay that way. My videos don‚Äôt go against any guidelines. I even had videos taken down, and I would message asking why it was taken down, but no response. I would rewatch my taken down videos confused how it goes against community guidelines. Especially because I see similar content on my For You Page.  I recommend not harping people like this. Because it‚Äôs frustrating to me that I put hours into making TikToks only for them to never be seen because they are kept ‚Äúunder review‚Äù.
I recommend not putting peoples videos ‚Äúunder review‚Äù until someone reports the video for going against guidelines. And send a reason why, that way it will be clearer on why the video was taken down and what the creator can avoid doing in their next TikTok video.
I love TikTok and I want to keep using it, but if the server is still going to keep me from posting then I might leave. I‚Äôll try and contact TikTok if the issue isn‚Äôt resolved because I know I‚Äôm not the only one to have videos constantly under review.
title: ‚ÄúUnder Review‚Äù

review: This is a review that I am adding after being on the app for a long time. Ive made a lot of videos on my account, and Im always making videos that are fun to watch, but go along with the guidlines. However I think the report and appeal system is very bad. I recently made a video that was actually me doing a trend that is on tiktok for halloween. It's a trend where you pore candle wax in water, and it will create the first letter of the person youre gonna marry. I tell you this because its a silly harmless tiktok that everyone is doing. About 3 minutes of me posting the video, someone reported it, and it was immediatly taken down without question. I was given the option to appeal which I did because the video I made didnt go against any guidlines (which I made sure to read to see if I actually did something) about 3 more minutes go by, and I'm told the same message except now it says that my appeal was denied. I understand we need this stuff for actual offensive and dangerous content, but I feel the reporter has too much power which leaves the appealer to have almost no say in the matter whether their video was offensive or not. Please fix this, I've dealt with this before, and many other popular creaters have as well and we're all tired of it.
title: Couple things...

review:
I have joined TikTok last year on my iPad Mini, posting videos everyday. Though I have some concerns that should be brought up. For starters, I am personally dissatisfied about having to wait an hour without liking anyone‚Äôs videos, It would be nice to like people‚Äôs videos without running into a problem. Another concern is not having enough fans to go ‚Äúlive‚Äù.  
I had hopes to go live a few weeks after I started my account but I haven‚Äôt had any progression. Honestly, I think you would need just 100 followers to go live on the app. I also don‚Äôt like how TikTok puts all famous people on my ‚ÄúFor you‚Äù page, I would like to give chances to smaller accounts, such as account with at least 30 followers. It would also be nice if there were less ads. When I first open TikTok on my phone, I see an ad about a trend or another app. I‚Äôm also scrolling through the For you page and see some random ad that doesn‚Äôt need to be on TikTok, although I know some ads promote movies. Another concern I have brought to attention is the use of cuss words. Cuss words have been found in almost all of the videos I watch. I am disappointed in the sound, and it gets to my head. Other than those concerns, I am proud to be apart of the TikTok community!
title: Love it but some problems..

review: Hands down one of the best apps out there. This isn‚Äôt just a social media app, this is a place of laughter, hands to your mouth, tearing eyes, and so much more emotions with this app. TikTok is not like Snapchat or Facebook, it‚Äôs better. It‚Äôs so amazing to see how many people do so many great things. You can explore memes, people giving to the homeless, adult jokes, and so much more. You can comment on posts for millions to see. Like videos to show support. Follow to show love. Share to friends to help the creator grow. You can look at any topic you like including: music, art, wholesome, funny, memes, aviation, news, school subjects, and so much more. If you want to get away from people or the world for a little, this is the place to go. There are things strictly on this app only for kids 13+. But with the new TikTok policy, everyone is safe(including children). You can even chat privately with creators that follow you and you follow them. In order to do that you need to verify your account by giving your phone  number. You can even make multiple accounts. TikTok is safe, fun, and engaging. All in all, TikTok is the go to app if your feeling lonely, sad, scared or more. Love you all! Thank you for reading.

title: I love the app but a few bugs

review: So I‚Äôm just gonna get straight to the point. TikTok is unable maintain a consistent enforcement of its community guidelines since they will refuse to take down videos that are in clear violation of community guidelines (for example acts of violence against people and animals, derogatory speech, sexual exploit, etc) or when they do try to ‚Äòenforce‚Äô guidelines, the app takes down videos that do not violate them but are falsely reported by a mass of trolls or go against the app‚Äôs ‚Äòagenda‚Äô. For the latter case, TikTok does not make an effort to work with creators who have been falsely accused and will shows little regard to have the video restored in most situations. It is quite intolerable that the app allows people to exploit its community guidelines just to harass or silence creators. Also, important social issues/injustices that people try to use their platform to call attention to have been silenced by TikTok through either limiting video‚Äôs showing in its algorithm or outright taking down the video with little explanation. Overall, I hope that TikTok is able to do something about this issue soon because for an app that is directed towards all ages, it not only puts people at risk, but displays a cruel injustice that can be simply resolved if the administrators of this app showed any sense of appreciation, decency, and care to the users and creators that make their app popular enough to yield a living and paycheck.

The people who work on TikTok seriously need to work more on how they monitor the app. A feature to make your profile only accessible to those 13 and older would be great ( its not like the app started out as a 13+ app or anything, no way, that‚Äôs not why there are 7 year olds using it now ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è ). That way, if a cosplayer wants to make a post with, say, SFX makeup that looks gory someone isn‚Äôt gonna come around and report it for no reason, because the profile is 13+. I dunno this feature and a lot of other features could be added to make the app better. Cyber bullying on tiktok is worse than ever right now, and I just hope that the app becomes a safe place to have fun again like it used to be. If you like music, messing with transitions, making new friends rather easily, etc. ... I recommend getting tiktok, if you are easily offended- it probably isn‚Äôt the app for you at the moment.

review: Honestly after having the app for a little over a year and deleting it it wasn‚Äôt what I expected. The community is very toxic and made me feel unwanted where I just wanted to make videos and watch them. Also some creators were very ‚Äúcrossing the line‚Äù per se, ie ThatVeganTeacher (I don‚Äôt know her status anymore because of all this stuff going on) harassing, bullying and even comparing not being vegan as a sin, and racism and sexism. Also some people didn‚Äôt have to work very hard for their clout, ie Charli D‚Äôamelio would just dance and get 100million followers. While other people would be making videos they put their heart and soul into and get none, my point being that it‚Äôs algorithm is pretty messed up. There‚Äôs also a lot of clickbait videos with the whole ‚Äúreality shifting‚Äù scandal and other various acts that try to get people to believe them even thought it‚Äôs completely fake. TikTok didn‚Äôt live up to what I thought it would be and it was toxic and messed up with people trying to get views but faking stuff. There have also been people pretending to be vampires and quite frankly i find that a bit weird. I understand that tiktok is a place to express yourself but some people make it unenjoyable with content like ‚Äúdancing‚Äù or just stealing content. Honestly i didn‚Äôt understand the hype around this app. it feels like a toxic place, and most of the content is stolen or just repetitive. 1/5 stars.
title: TikTok

review: TikTok is a fairly fun app to use but it‚Äôs honestly starting to not be so fun. TikTok will unjustly take down your videos for anything and everything. Whether it be about the black community or the asian community or the Mexican community. I‚Äôve seen TikTok try to silence them. Same with the lgbtqia+ people and the people who are trying to speak up about body shaming and self love as well as animal cruelty. And even if your videos don‚Äôt get taken down there‚Äôs a high chance of being shadowbanned where you can post all you want but it‚Äôs not like you‚Äôll get many views. OH AND DONT GET ME STARTED ON SOME OF THE PEOPLE THAT USE THE APP AND HAVE NOT HAD THEIR ACCOUNT TAKEN AWAY. There have been numerous pedophiles on this app and you can report all you want but those reports most likely wound even be taken into consideration until there‚Äôs at least more than 50 reports. There‚Äôs also the anime fans WHO TAKE IT WAY TO F*ING FAR. Then there‚Äôs also the people that can‚Äôt simply block the account so they resort to death threats and doxxing. No matter the situation that is not something you do because of how scarring and reckless that is AND DOXXING IS A CRIME YET SOME PEOPLE FAIL TO REALIZE THAT. I‚Äôve also noticed how ableist and racist people get to keep their account while any other account that decides to speak on thing will get banned. It‚Äôs just an unfair and corrupt system that TikTok has its really stupid.

So, I‚Äôm a cosplayer and we‚Äôre a fairly big community on TikTok. The problem is, TikTok shadowbans us. Our content is not shown to the world, causing our hard work and efforts to go down the drain. I have to constantly keep making new accounts so people can see my content. You shouldn‚Äôt shadowban people for using the same tags over again multiple times. It makes it clear what its from, what character, what the video‚Äôs about, etc. 
I‚Äôve had to take down videos and reupload because you shadowban my account and nothing is shown to anyone. Even after reuploading, it never seems to get anywhere either. 
I spend SO much money for this and you trash it like it‚Äôs nothing. Its cruel how you do this. As much as I may hate the app for this, I still remain on it because of how happy it can make me sometimes. It gets hard to enjoy it when all you do is shadowban and delete my content. It‚Äôs unfair and disgusting. 
At least let us KNOW before you go ahead and block all of our content. Like, give us cosplayers a warning, and then we‚Äôll start using different tags, or calming down on our posts a little. We aren‚Äôt spamming the hashtag or making inappropriate tiktoks, we‚Äôre making our cosplays known. It‚Äôs insanely difficult to do that because of this, and it angers me, as well as many others, a lot. Fix your app, it‚Äôs horrible.

title: Severe issues ruined this for me

review: It seems like every day there are more and more restrictions being placed on creators, but not much is done about the really bad videos or accounts. There are obvious cases of ‚Äúgrooming‚Äù, targeted at both adults and children. There are people doing hard drugs, nearly completely naked, doing explicit sexual acts or raunchy suggestive routines. There is a MASSIVE amount of hate speech, racism, homophobia, religious persecution, and other prejudice. Extremely dangerous misinformation, radical opinions expressed on such a way as to incite hate, violence, or vandalism. Self harming, serious threats being made, harassment (extremely common), dangerous advice, slander and libel, the list goes on and on...and so many of them get reported multiple times but somehow don‚Äôt violate community standards??? They allow songs about everything under the sun, including marijuana, and have stickers pertaining to marijuana, but we aren‚Äôt allowed to talk about it or tag it or build a community around this medicinal plant, that has been legalized for medicinal and/or recreational use and decriminalized in a vast majority of states in the US. I believe there are 2 states left where it is completely illegal (They should try and keep up!) Until the algorithm is fixed and so are the ways in which the guidelines are enforced, I‚Äôm being generous with 2 stars. TikTok, DO BETTER.
title: Community guidelines have gotten out of control

review: Tik Tok obviously is not a platform for children to be browsing on, so I don't understand what the problem is with a little bit of adult humor. There are way too many people who get offended by little things. For example, I made a video simply following a trend of doing a certain dance aggressively. Out of nowhere, a ton of people started hating in the comments for "being rude to the creator of the dance" by doing it aggressively. Then in a week or two, the video was "under review" and still has been under review for 4 weeks now. Tik Tok rarely ever responds to reports and also shadowbans way too many good content creators. These content creators are probably the reason a lot of people still use the app, so why shadowban them? They're just helping you expand your platform to multiple types of audiences. Also, the views system must be addressed. I have over 20,000 followers and a lot of my videos maintain a very high like-to-view ratio, yet they don't receive nearly as many views as one would expect that it should get. For smaller accounts, this continues to be an issue. Less views means less exposure, which thus means less followers. Tik Tok also seems to tend to give my less successful videos way too many likes, which have a horrible like:view percentage. These views should instead go to the content that people like more.

review: I absolutely love tik tok. I am so addicted and so are all of my friends. However, I feel that the video review process is a bit odd. Many videos contain curse words, but curse words are counted as a violation of community guidelines when used in captions or comments. Many people post videos of them drinking and will mention in the caption that they are of legal drinking age and that they do not recommend underage drinking, yet will be penalized for it (when many other videos are not). I once posted a video that was inspired by several other videos on the app, which contained short clips of each friend of mine drinking, and then passing the drink to the next person. My video was taken down due to a violation of community guidelines, so I submit an appeal mentioning how everyone in the video was 21. It got put back up but got barely any views, so I reposted it. It got taken down immediately and they did not accept my second appeal? It does not make sense and was not fair considering they accepted my first appeal. I can see that many other people have this problem and I just wonder why they are so strict when some of these videos that violate community guidelines are actually great (and extremely popular) content.

title: Live

review:
Once you get into tiktok it‚Äôs a like a little world. But I have some complaints. 

     First off, the lives. Only people over 1000 followers get to go live, which I think is ridiculous. Maybe you should give new users around 25-50 followers when they first start so at least they have something.  Secondly,  you need to fix your issue where people randomly get suspended by their lives for getting reported. When someone is reporting you should make it a REQUIREMENT to have evidence and if they don‚Äôt have any, their complaint is invalid.  Thirdly, the age limit. It needs to be where people only up to 20-25 should be able to sign up, minus ‚Äúthebentist‚Äù and the other cool, family friendly tik-tokers that everyone loves.  I think this because girls and boys are constantly getting verbally harassed by older people on tiktok, such as the Budday.  They are being forced to do things they don‚Äôt want to or see graphic things. Or are tricked to give personal info such as their number, email, etc. These are just a few of my complaints. Please work on these because these are universal problems on TikTok.

                                             Thanks!

It slaps. But do you really need my advice?  Is anyone even reading this?  Stop.  Stop reading it.  STOP I SAID.  Whatever.  Keep reading then. I could do this all day. Taping away on my phone, wasting time we both could be spending enjoying TikTok. Wait is it TicTok or TikTok? Did you look?  Are you sure you‚Äôre not reading some review of a knock off app? Nevermind, it‚Äôs TikTok. Pretty sure.

If you‚Äôre still reading this congrats.  Only 2.1% of readers make it this far. And believe me, there is much much more to come.  Up next...actually there isn‚Äôt. This has been fun, for both of us, but it‚Äôs getting ridiculous, right? I mean, what is the point of this? Why, oh Lord, why? Why won‚Äôt he stop? And by ‚Äòhe‚Äô I mean me. Ok, that‚Äôs it. I‚Äôm calling it.  Once you start referring to yourself in the third person, it‚Äôs time to...do some other thing, or something.  I don‚Äôt know.  I never said I was good at reviews. Oh, right.  The review.  TikTok is good.  How‚Äôs that?  Believable?  It is true too.

I guess there was a lot more after all. Sorry about that.  In conclusion, if you read this far, maybe TikTok isn‚Äôt for you after all.  Instead, make some human friends.  Peace.

review: So I have an account that has just under 7,500 followers. Some of my videos have been taken down due to community guideline violations, yet I paid close attention to what the guidelines were changing to when they made a change so I specifically didn‚Äôt get hit with them. First, my videos would get hit with ‚ÄúMinor safety‚Äù violations and I would get no help when submitting appeals. I‚Äôm 19 years old and nothing in the videos I post breaks the ‚ÄúMinor safety‚Äù guideline. But now, I‚Äôm being hit with ‚ÄúAdult nudity and sexual activity‚Äù violations for videos where I blatantly do the same thing someone else did because they got good views for it and I wanted to see those same numbers but because I‚Äôm a smaller content creator, they crack down on accounts like me yet continue to push creators like Zoey Laverne and Tony Lopez who have both allegedly messed around with children. On top of that, the amount of videos that get posted with people throwing around sexually explicit toys that are allowed to stay up is shocking. On an app made for children. So if you‚Äôre thinking about becoming a content creator on TikTok, prepare for a support system that‚Äôs absolutely nonexistent with vague answers as to why these things happen. I wish this app had a better line of communication between the people who uphold the community guidelines and small content creators.
title: TikTok doesn‚Äôt care about small creators

title: TikTok Review

review: Hi love this app so much as a content creator. It is fun, it‚Äôs easy, and the communities you create are fantastic. Also I love that there is gifting within the app. The is a but however.... There seems to be issues with TT‚Äôs reporting process. For example, I had a video reported and taken down because it ‚Äúviolated‚Äù TT‚Äôs guidelines. I‚Äôve read their guidelines twice and it does not. It also seems that you can report someone for any reason, and even if it is not true, that person can lose their ‚Äúgo live‚Äù privileges, or even a temporary ban. There should be an appeal process with TT admins and someone to speak to regarding these issues. Also, while some accounts are getting banned or having features temporarily turned off for no apparent reason, there are bully accounts growing a rapid rates. These accounts depict hate towards veterans, the disabled, age, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender, etc. it breaks my heart every time I run into these accounts and see how they mistreat the helpless. SHAME on TikTok for not having a better system to address this. I really hope I can come back and give 5 stars in the future. But for now I‚Äôm at 3.

title: Good bye tik tok

review: I really love the app, super fun! Love almost all the audios. Though there is lots of negative energy but it‚Äôs social media so you can‚Äôt expect too much. I just wish my videos were viewed more. Sometimes I would actually dedicate a decent amount of time for the creation of a tiktok only for it to get 20 views and 3 likes... but I do really enjoy watching other creators videos, very occupying and entertaining! I also feel as though videos that were not harmful in any shape, way or form get deleted/taken down and it‚Äôs unfair to the creators who may have spent some time on it. During this time, many people are speaking up about the injustices happening (blm) and lots of those videos get taken down when they have not violated any of the guidelines which I personally think is unfair to not only the creator but the people who are also largely invested in the blm movement. But to conclude, this app is very fun for millions and to be honest-for me personally- this app has helped me get through some of my darkest times in 2020. And I feel as though I‚Äôm not the only one who really appreciates the joy that comes from many of the accounts on this app.
title: Pretty Decent

review:
hi! ive been using tiktok daily for a few months now as a creator, and ive noticed a few problems.
firstly, i have about 2,800 followers. all of a sudden kids who look to be 7-10 (for SURE not the minimum age of 13!) are following me more than anyone my age (18.) i cosplay so i dont know if its because they see a cool costume or smthn and just follow, but i dont make content for children and removing child follower after child follower is really stressful! i even have 13+ in my bio :( please try to make sure there are only 13+ ppl on ur app. i understand a lot of it is also the parents fault, but maybe theres smthn u could do :/
also, shadowbanning and randomly deleted videos is a huge issue, especially now that BLM is on the rise. if tiktok really supports BLM, then why do my tiktoks on the topic get significantly less views/likes than all of my cosplay videos, even when my followers support the movement too? and i rarely use tags so i should have the same reach as always. please try to focus more on banning people who are spreading hate instead of the people who are working for positivity.
other than these (annoying) issues, i adore this app!! ive made so many friends on it. there are ao many different sides to tiktok, youll for sure find your niche.
title: under 13/shadowbanning

review: i love tiktok and think it‚Äôs a very great app. A lot of parents disagree saying it‚Äôs inappropriate and bad but have never even had the app. from someone who has had tiktok for a while now i know how strict tiktok is when posting a video. barely any inappropriate content is allowed. one thing i hear from many parents is ‚Äúrandom people can see your videos and you don‚Äôt know them and what if they are dangerous!‚Äù. if you are worried about random people seeing your kid‚Äôs videos you can just make a private account. your for you page is based off the videos you like. if you don‚Äôt want to see certain types of video you don‚Äôt have to. you can say you‚Äôre not interested and they will slowly stop showing up on your for you page. the only things i would change is having a ‚Äúare you sure you would like to refresh the page‚Äù button and choosing you your friends only group is. so if you want to have a public account you can but still be able to post a video to certain friends you‚Äôd like without having to make two different accounts. hope this was helpful!

But now that I have 2/3 of the accounts deleted and want to login into my main account, it won‚Äôt let me due to ‚Äúwrong account or password‚Äù which then leads me to an email section. So I typed in the two possible emails and it still says that the account is wrong... I can‚Äôt use the phone number login because my newest (3rd) account was never set up with it because ‚Äúphone number already used‚Äù.. so I‚Äôve never got to have the full usage of the app through the messaging, which is unfortunate. title: Loved it before

review: I LOVE this app so much but there is one major problem that needs to be addressed, the bugs. I‚Äôm not sure if this actually is a bug but it‚Äôs still something that needs to be worked on, the algorithm. The TikTok algorithm is very weird and glitchy... I‚Äôm not sure if it was meant to be like this but it seems that only people who are straight, white, skinny, and do weird ‚Äútrendy‚Äù dances can get on the fyp (for you page). It is also very hard to gain followers because of this. The algorithm tends to really ignore creators that fall into the LGBTQ category, liberal category, cosplay category, anime category, or if you are just a poc who speaks out about the injustices in the world. TikTok algorithm will do something that is called shadow banning to creators if they aren‚Äôt ‚Äútrendy‚Äù and since it is very difficult to get on the fyp this happens to a lot of people. There are also things to talk about such as the actual bugs like when TikTok will randomly break for no reason, when you lose followers that didn‚Äôt actually unfollow you, and when you don‚Äôt get notifications when you should be. These are just a few things that have happened so far and I STRONGLY urge TikTok to try and fix these problems before they lose a whole bunch of people.

title: Wow

review:
My account was recently permanently banned. After going through the guidelines, nothing I posted violated community guidelines. Worse yet, the app is supposed to have an ‚Äúappeal‚Äù option and it wouldn‚Äôt show up. Contacted customer support through the only way I could find in both the app and one the website, and I still have no clear explanation as to why my account was PERMANENTLY banned and no clear way to appeal their decision. I‚Äôm incredibly disappointed because I really enjoyed TikTok and made sure my videos fell within guidelines. I posted a ‚ÄúHappy Memorial Day‚Äù video with some planes flying over from an air show, and within hours my account was taken down. Previously I posted videos of my die cast car collection, and am completely unsure how any of those would land me in ‚Äúpermanently banned‚Äù mode.

Don‚Äôt put too much effort into your account if you have one...the app developers can clearly take away all your hard work in an instant for no clear reason. If there had been a reason for the ban, I wouldn‚Äôt be leaving this review, but since I didn‚Äôt violate any guidelines to my best knowledge (and I have reviewed the guidelines to make sure), and was given no explanation, I am making sure I share my story with friends and whoever will listen so they don‚Äôt have to feel the same way I did after all my work was gone.

title: Hello

review: I began 2020 uncertain of where I was headed. My dreams had come true in 2019 with a new home but, I was entering this new home alone. My Joshua had gone to Rainbow Bridge in 2015 and my loss had hit hard. I wanted my new beginning to be a healing but, it turned into more heartache, tears and loneliness. The 2020 Rona hit scared me to no end with elderly parents and my brother living with them and he may have heeded the mask wearing but, never stopped heading out to places where way too many chances of spreading the virus was possible. Going into May I began working from home which was, also, a dream come true yet, it hit me even harder. So as you can see...my life was sucking in my HEAD..Mentally I was a mess! Then came Tik Tok and I became addicted but, as it worked it‚Äôs magic I began to feel whole, again. I know I was working on myself as I listened to affirmations, laughter, with friendships developing and loneliness ending. I tried my hand at some videos and my confidence is growing again. I see 2021 as a new beginning. And I have my Tik Tok friends to thank ü•∞üíØ‚ú®And Tik Tok for being an outlet to releasing the negative and filling up my heart with the positivity.

title: I‚Äôm sooo addicted

review:
Tik Tok has been selective about what content they take down when reported in a way that benefits white supremacy. Currently there is an account on their platform that is putting George Floyd's face on life sized dolls and doing a number of disturbing things with the dolls. From running the dolls over with a steam roller to having the doll thrust when audio is played that says his murderer's name. This account has been reported probably hundreds of times by various other accounts (mine included) and yet the result is that Tik Tok every single time so far has determined that that type of content "doesn't violate community guidelines."

In addition to this many creators and users of the app (myself included) have noticed that white creators are routinely allowed to use the n word (content doesn't get removed when reported) while Black creators have their content removed and even their accounts suspended when they stitch this content in attempt to raise awareness and ask the white creators to stop using harmful language. BIPOC creators also get their content removed and their accounts suspended for simply talking about the discrimination they face in their every day lives. 

This app needs to stop protecting white supremacists and denying BIPOC creators the ability to speak out against issues that directly harm them.
title: Absolutely deplorable follow through on community guidelines

title: Need to CHANGE/UNACCEPTABLE

review: I absolutely love tiktok. It is so addicting and if you‚Äôre following users that post the content you like, it is probably the most entertaining app out there. I also love making my own videos and actually receiving recognition for them, unlike any other platform where only the people that follow you can see your content. As much as I love this app, there are also frustrating aspects of it. If you ever have a problem on tiktok and send them questions regarding it, don‚Äôt expect a response. Tiktok is terrible with responding to issues. My account has recently been blocked from posting for a week because I broke community guidelines, which is fine and I understand that, however - when I got it back after a week, I posted three videos in one day, none of which were a threat to the community guidelines whatsoever, and that same day I got blocked again! I have tried reaching out to them through the apps ‚Äúreport and issue ‚Äú section, email, and even Instagram! They have never gotten back to me and my account remains blocked. I take my account seriously as well as I have a good amount of followings. Tiktok, please resolve this issue of removing videos that aren‚Äôt inappropriate or blocking accounts that are innocent.
title: Fun but frustrating

review: So first I would like to say I really do love the app for many reasons, but there are also many reasons why it is becoming my least favorite app now. One reason being, is that when anyone reports a video, even for no reason at all where it is not breaking community guidelines, the app does not allow it to be visible on your profile and is ‚Äúunder review‚Äù. One of mine was supposedly reported even though it did not break any community guidelines (and I read the full rules in fine print for the app) and it has been hidden from my profile to everyone for months. This happens on lives as well, if someone reports it the app automatically makes the live stop, even if it did not break any community guidelines. If someone wants to report a video, the video should be visible until deemed otherwise if it is in fact breaking any rules, then it should be deleted. Many users work hard for their content and they shouldn‚Äôt be punished for the small percentage of people who report any random content for whatever pleasure it brings them if it doesn‚Äôt break any guidelines. The app should also notify the user if their video was reported and is under review with factual evidence on why it is under review so the user can learn from it for next time, or if it is a mistake, can be resolved. And that is why I am rating it 1 star as of this time.

title: Very addicted to this app BUT

review: This app is a great way to find funny/cool content. I would give TikTok 5 stars if I wouldn‚Äôt have had as many issues with my account. I have had my account taken down without any videos violating the community guidelines. Just like that, no warning, just my account with thousands of followers gone. I appealed this decision and got it back about a week later. I read over the entire community guidelines and made absolutely sure none of my videos violated them. Recently, I‚Äôve had my account taken down for the second time without any reason why whatsoever. There was not any video I posted that ever violated the community guidelines yet my account is gone for the second time and I‚Äôll have to appeal it again. Other creators have had the same issue, they‚Äôll sign into the app and see their account is removed and they don‚Äôt know why. TikTok is great in terms of finding the videos you want to see. But I‚Äôm terms of creating videos I don‚Äôt know if I recommend it given that I‚Äôve put a lot of effort into my own videos just to have my whole account vanish for no reason‚Ä¶twice.

title: Maybe you could change the age limit

review: The number of creators I see talking about being shadowbanned despite breaking zero community guidelines is ridiculous. Not to mention! Most of these creators are people of color, queer, or both. The rest are allies. Anyone who speaks out in favor of the BLM movement frequently gets shot down by the apparently impartial company, despite others posting from the other side facing no consequences. It got to the point where the whole blacklivesmatter tag was blocked. They‚Äôve done this not only to the black community and allies but to any minority group, including but not limited to: indigenous peoples, Hispanic Americans, Asian Americans, the LGBT community, and the disabled community. It‚Äôs honestly disgusting that the company (and that‚Äôs what it is, a company. No decision is made by one good hearted person) claims to support these communities while simultaneously silencing them for the benefit of PR. I‚Äôm joining the Juneteenth walkout of this app, and I‚Äôm happy to do so. They need to understand that their users do have power over what happens to the app as a whole. We write their paycheck. If they want to keep saying whatever they think will calm their consumers while their actions reflect the opposite of their words, they can watch those consumers leave one by one. If they want to keep siding with the oppressor, they can face the consequences. We‚Äôre not stupid. We demand to be heard.
title: Shadow banning is out of control

review: I love TikTok so much, but there are a few things I think should be different. When it says ‚Äútapping too fast‚Äù, I could just be spamming an account or liking my friends videos, and then I won‚Äôt be able to like any more for like three hours. I think that TikTok should really put this into consideration because a lot of people that I know agree with me, and don‚Äôt get the point. Another thing that I think should be changed about TikTok is that you have to have 1,000 followers to go live. I think it should be less, but not like 100 or something because than almost all the people I follow would be going live constantly. If this were to happen, my notifications would be spammed all the time. And if it were to stay at 1,000, it might help people feel like they accomplished something. Although, people that don‚Äôt get attention don‚Äôt get on the for you page as much as popular creators. I think that this should change too, because everyone on TikTok deserves to get a chance. But if it were to change to this, I feel like people that make pointless videos would show up too much. Thanks!
title: TikTok!

review: My TikTok doesn‚Äôt receive the latest versions of the app until a long while later and it‚Äôs not fair when people are being reported for no reason. I don‚Äôt get why we need that. title: The update

review:
‚ÄúK-I-S-S‚Äù comes to mind.  ‚ÄúSIMPLE‚Äù, to the point messages. ‚ÄúKEEP‚Äù, ‚ÄúIT‚Äù that way, ‚ÄúSUPERSTAR‚Äú! We are all hungry for information, short and sweet, to the point ALWAYS works very well! 

Some negative comments about religion hurt our global community by putting doubts in people‚Äôs minds, especially young people. We need a moral compass. Yes, all organized religion have  their short coming. But, there are ways to point that out without condemning it. It takes years of study, research, wisdom and daily practice to see the pros and cons. It‚Äôs too easy to have a bad experience, or not to see miracles, then blame isolated incidences, by stereotyping religions. There are bad people everywhere. There are good people, who do or think bad things. That is what the human entity is‚Ä¶not perfect, by no means. We each must do good, to better our world. That moral compass comes in pretty handy. Without it we‚Äôll will eventually see the end of civilization. Too much ‚ÄúHOLLYWOOD‚Äù religion‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs all about me, my status, my things, do ‚Äúme‚Äù, without thinking about consequences. Yes, darn, those consequences!

title: My rating for TikTok

review:
First off, this app is a very good app. I‚Äôm always at home and this keeps me happy and entertained. It‚Äôs not the best app for kids but over all a good app. On the downside, I wanted to go on the app to see what ppl where up to. I go on there and it said it starts on tiktok. I thought nothing of it and continue to look at the app when I go all the way in the app it changed my whole settings. I changed it 
to black settings and it went to white settings, etc. But the one thing that caught my eye is that all my drafts are gone. I think that it‚Äôs just the app been laggy so I log out and log back in. It still says that I have no drafts. So I‚Äôm like ‚Äúoh like it‚Äôs fine it just laggy I just have to give it some time for it to work.‚Äù Time goes by and it still doesn‚Äôt show my drafts. title: Pretty good app to get but some bad

review: Honestly no other app can compare to tik tok. It‚Äôs by far my favorite app and i use it constantly, although maybe too much but i see that as not a negative. It‚Äôs the only app that really promotes such a wide array of content and really tailors content to you. The only drawback I would say is the fact that sometimes it is really hard to have your content put out to other people, as the algorithm seems to be spotty in its ability to recognize content and promote it to a wider audience. This leads to many videos not reaching the amount of people you had hoped for and there is no real way to get it promoted. But this issue is not a big one, as from time to time my content seems to reach a wider audience, and so is the nature of life, you win some you loose some.
