review: The common idea is that TikTok is for kids. I am here to tell you that is 100% not true. There is a HUGE community of Adults on TikTok, and we are all able to have FUN and express ourselves in a way that can be silly, serious, goofy, or ANYWAY that you want. There is the "for you" page that allows you to browse through various broadcasters. To build the type of content you would like to continue seeing, you simply press the heart icon on the right hand side of the page. After a while TikTok will only show you the type of content that interests you based on your previous likes.  If you want to continue to see content from a particular person, simply press the plus sign on the right side of the page. This user will now show up on your "following" page ( located on the top left of your TikTok main page). This application can be VERY therapeutic for those of you that would like to create content. It allows you to express yourself in anyway that you want. I recommend this app 100% for boomers, Gen-X, Millennials, and ANYONE else who feels they might be too old for this app!!!

review: I have had Tiktok since its conception in late August of 2018. I have seen every trend, every audio, every personalities rise and fall and then some. I went from daily and constant use, to having restrain myself to 10 videos at a time as to not lose myself in the app. But then they started editing the algorithm, catering to your interests and likes. This causes you to be completely consumed. It gives children, teenagers, and young adults a platform like never before, finding fame almost instantaneously if you understand how the app works and youre willing to sell your soul. My problem is not with how the app functions; it does its job perfectly. No, my problem is with the creators themselves. This is a Chinese app, there is an entire side of the app we cannot see we are not allowed to see and it begs the question what is on it? Thats also not my problem. Tiktok has demonstrated multiple times that it silences certain creators, and it is constant. Black people have been silenced. In light of recent events and the importance of awareness of the BLACK LIVES MATTER movement in the U.S. and now internationally, TikTok has deleted the hashtag #blacklivesmatter and related tags in an attempt to what I can assume is silence black voices and supporters. It is tiresome and disappointing and the app along with every police department in the U.S. deserves to burn.

title: Fix this problem please thank you

review:
Lately, with the new community guidelines, I have been having some trouble. A lot of the videos I have been posting are getting taken down. There is no gore, no violence, and nothing that could possibly violate guidelines besides a fake wine glass. I am a minor and cannot drink wine, so for a necessary prop to the cosplay (The version of Aziraphale in the reverse Omens au) I used water with red dye in it with a wine glass. I even put disclaimers in the caption that it‚Äôs dyed water and not real, but it still gets taken down. I explained all of this in my appeal, but they denied it. I was extremely lucky to have thought of screen recording all the drafts I had taken as him, because once a video gets taken down, there‚Äôs no saving it to your camera roll. In the next update, it would be nice if we could save videos that have gotten deleted. A lot of them are harmless and cosplayers who worked extremely hard on that content, just for it to go to waste (with no way of getting it back to save it for themselves). Tiktok used to be my favorite app, but the severe decline in posting rights is disappointing. 
Sincerely,
     A concerned cosplayer (who is above the age of 14 and not drinking wine)
title: Cosplayer problems

review: It seems this app definitely only likes accounts with a significant amount of followers. So many accounts with highly inappropriate content..remain online with an ungodly amount of views and comments simply because they have a high follower count. My teen daughter‚Äôs account was recently ‚Äúpermanently banned for multiple violations of community guidelines.‚Äù She only ever got one warning and video deleted (it wasn‚Äôt even an original video..it was a viral tik tok video she did..which constitutes about 97% of all tik tok videos). The original and recreated videos still exist and accounts are still open. No other warnings or anything else. She loved tik tok and spent time learning dances and recreating others videos, as is the point of the platform. But she didn‚Äôt have a high follower account. I searched and searched for who to email and ask for reason/proof behind the permanent ban. There is ZERO way to contact anyone. My daughter loved the creative platform but was shut out for zero reason. I personally monitored her posts. There was zero reason for the permanent ban other than her account not being popular. Way to to Tik Tok. As if teens don‚Äôt have enough reason to feel bullied and insignificant..you punish those who aren‚Äôt ‚Äúpopular‚Äù and delete the videos they spent time and effort to create and post. It‚Äôs disgusting.

review:
First off, I‚Äôd like to begin with how the first paragraph was already written out for me which just goes to show how the messed up the algorithm really is.

to begin with, Videos are getting taken down even though they don‚Äôt violate the guidelines, videos with people telling others to end their lives, insulting them, or copywriting other people‚Äôs ideas will get reported over and over again but they NEVER get taken down. Not to mention toxic channels, I‚Äôm finding channels that only exist to make fun of other people and no matter how many times they get reported nothing happens. Meanwhile people will have their account suspended for saying a swear word or showing a fake weapon/gore.

Also, I‚Äôm constantly seeing popular creators complaining about how at least half of their followers aren‚Äôt seeing their videos. They‚Äôre constantly getting shadow banned for no reason and it really does take a toll on not only their love for this app, but mine too. These people have done nothing wrong and are very unproblematic, the only reason they‚Äôre losing traction is because they‚Äôre cosplayers/trans/add tags about BLM or LGBT. Please find a way to fix this so everyone can see their videos, we followed them for a reason and then never get to see their content.

review: Tiktok is an amazing app that allows you to make short videos of anything you want. There are dances you can learn, tutorials on things like led light colors, cleaning things out of carpetsüíÄüíÄ and many more! There are so many sides of tiktok too! For example, there is straight tiktok. This is where all of the dancing, slime, povs, and main stuff happens. Alt tiktok is where you get a mix of deep/creepy/funny videos and straight tiktok videos. Deep tiktok is the deepest side of tiktok that is very hard to get to. This is where all of the dark memes and vibes happen. I am on deep tiktok because there is absolutely no drama, no political comments, and all in all it‚Äôs a straight up vibe. There is theatre tiktok, Barbie tiktok, broccoli tiktok, and so many other sides. It‚Äôs actually insane how many sides of tiktok I have been on! You can add videos to favorites, hold down on the video and select not interested if you don‚Äôt like a video, and there are settings to manage your account. You can change videos to private or friends only so you can choose who sees the video or not. It‚Äôs a great way to pass the time and make new friends!

review: I‚Äôve used this app for nearly 2.5 years and in the last 4 months the app has takin a turn for the worst. They were already silencing POC creators but now they‚Äôve upped their game to silencing BIPOC, disabled, LGBTQ+, Jewish and many other creators simply because they aren‚Äôt willing to put in the time to actually listen to their complaints about the app. The platform is overrun with trolls who take every opportunity to harass and belittle these types of creators and in response not only did Tiktok start hiding these creators, by damaging their reach and cutting their views, they took away the only feature that allowed you to talk to a real person. The entire help section is now automated with not a single human in sight to actually look into what‚Äôs wrong. They have no means of communication with anyone on the help team because it doesn‚Äôt actually exist. The policy has become ‚Äúban first check later‚Äù, where the creator being harassed is punished for simply existing while the troll gets off Scott free. It‚Äôs disgusting and a real shame considering the people who fought the hardest to plead this app‚Äôs case against the Trump fiasco are being dehumanized and thrown aside in favor of the hateful and bigoted bullies who‚Äôve gone out of their way to turn a once exciting and welcoming platform into a hellscape

review:
I definitely understand that this app does its best to stop bullying. I do not blame the app, I blame the people. There is so much and I feel like In order to stop it, you should suspend anyone who bullies. When I report things, I know when they get reported but I never get a follow up on what has happened and what has been done. I feel like when reporting stuff, you should allow the person reporting a video or someone to explain exactly what they are reporting and why, not just a selecting a choice on why they are reporting. There are many other reasons why one reports a video. I feel like you should create a feature on the app that allows one to explain why they report a video. In addition, there are some users on the app that make accounts solely for the purpose of bullying and they don‚Äôt even hide it. They make references to racism, suicide, and stuff like that while laughing and making jokes about them. I have tried reporting  multiple accounts like this, but they never get suspended or banned. I believe that in a case like this...you need to do more in banning these bullies. In my opinion, banning isn‚Äôt taking this far.

review: I've used tiktok for a couple of years now but recently it feels like my algorithm keeps pushing videos that I don't want to see :/ My fyp was exactly how I wanted it about a month ago since I like videos about games I enjoy, artists and jokes I like, etc. but recently it feels like every few videos on my for you page there's something I'm not interested in at all with millions of likes. Despite clicking "not interested" on these videos that keep appearing out of nowhere, the tiktok fyp keeps flooding me with popular videos that have nothing to do with my interests like hair tips and dancing videos. There's nothing wrong with videos like these being on tiktok but it's frustrating to see them show up over and over when I've never liked any videos that would push this content onto my fyp so much. It's gotten to the point where I've actually just closed out the app after a few minutes and went onto other video sharing apps just so I can see more content like I actually want to see. I'm not sure what caused such an abrupt change in the tiktok algorithm, but I'd rather see videos pertaining to my interests similar to ones I've liked even if they aren't popular as opposed to popular videos that I don't really care about :(

title: Tiktok | Leaving My Review!

review:
Before you get this app, just know this precaution. I one hundred percent believe that Tiktok can be used as an outlet and a source of happiness for so many creators. But, for me, it has turned into something much darker. 
     I began spending maybe thirty minutes per day on this app at the start of this year, when I downloaded it for the first time. But slowly, as we trudged into quarantine, it began swallowing four, five and even a possible six hours of my day. It has caused me to avoid going outside, to avoid making interactions, and recently avoid doing important schoolwork, which is causing my grades to decline faster than I need them to. All I want people reading this to know is this app can be extremely addicting, so set limits for utilizing Tiktok. Make sure you don‚Äôt waste the sunlight watching other people live their dreams. Make your own dreams. 
     As a rehabilitation from this app, I decided to delete it once and for all and see how much better my life is without it. I know for many people it doesn't get this bad, especially adults, but STOP and assess how much time you could be wasting on social media. If you have read until here, this means something. It means that you are more than a watcher of a screen. Have a great day! Thank you for your consideration! :)

review: This app wastes your time like nothing else and reprograms your brain to have a short attention span due to its quick gratification time in the form of short videos. The app is also owned by a Chinese company that has little to no respect for your online privacy, and also censors freedom of speech, especially content criticizing the totalitarian Chinese government and its abuse and total disregard of the human rights of its citizens. A fair amount of users also post content that is misleading or outright false, especially when it comes to political matters. This is all on top of the relatively obnoxious and sometimes outright dangerous trends that are started on this app. Some users post entertaining, original, and witty content, but a fair amount also post obnoxious, dangerous, lewd, or otherwise inappropriate content. Yes, this is technically their right to free speech and expressing themselves, but you should ask yourself how much you personally are willing to expose yourself to. Also, if you are a parent, carefully consider what you are willing to expose your children to. Also, I am not a boomer, I‚Äôm well within the target demographic of this app and regrettably have also used it and given it a fair shake. In conclusion, don‚Äôt get this app, you‚Äôll save yourself a lot of time that you wouldn‚Äôt be able to get back.

I do not use this app as much because I am so tired of their racist actions. I actually had a comment taken down once because it ‚Äúviolated community guidelines‚Äù when, in fact, it did not. I searched through their community guidelines for a reason as to why my comment got taken down, and even asked for an answer, which they never gave. My comment was in no way bad, as I was just calling out that how certain people responded to the video was inappropriate. I have been harassed on the app, and after reporting those comments was met with ‚Äúthe comments did not violate community guidelines.‚Äù Why should I support an app that encourages sexism, racism, and bullying? Older men post very inappropriate videos referencing sexual things in response to posts of CHILDREN. However, these posts are not ‚Äúviolating community guidelines‚Äù and remain up even after being reported numerous times. This app should be embarrassed. What a shame, because the app would be fun without all the hypocrisy.

review:
I rate tiktok a 5/5 personally and here‚Äôs why. To start off when you make an acc it asks you what your interested in. Everything you select will be on your fyp (for you page). If you want to follow people there‚Äôs also a following page, there you can see everyone you follows videos.

When you make an account you have the option to make it public or private. If you have it public ANYONE can see your vids. If you have it private people would have to request you to see your vids. You can also put your vids on friends only (people who follow you and you follow them back) or private (only visible to you). Also if you have a video you like but don‚Äôt want to post you can keep it in your drafts. 

I don‚Äôt recommend this app for kids 10 and under and here‚Äôs why. There is some inappropriate videos but you can simply click ‚Äúnot interested‚Äù and you won‚Äôt see videos like that anymore. There‚Äôs also cuss words but there‚Äôs some audios that the cuss words are blurred out. It‚Äôs a very fun app and I really recommend it. That‚Äôs why I would rate it 5/5.
title: My review

review:
Problem one, 
My younger sister had an account that was deleted recently. I know for a fact, because I keep tabs on her content, that she didn‚Äôt break the rules that you barely enforce. She‚Äôs enjoying herself and you deleted her page without telling her and for no reason. Absolutely not cool. It isn‚Äôt just her, you‚Äôve done this with other pages that have done nothing to break the rules. This needs to be changed or you‚Äôll lose the people making you money. 
Problem two,
I‚Äôve complained about this before and yet nothing has been done to change it. Shadow banning my videos. This is a shady version of censorship Tik Tok does that is irritating and disgraceful. Incase you don‚Äôt know this is happening, unlikely, I‚Äôll define it. Shadowbanning is when TikTok blocks a video on your page but doesn‚Äôt tell you it‚Äôs been blocked. So, your fans don‚Äôt see the video but you do. It‚Äôs so irritating. This should never be a form of censorship on any platform, including one with rising popularity. I‚Äôve uploaded so many harmless dancing videos and cosplay videos that have been shadowbanned for no reason. And then when I upload a video redirecting my fans to a different platform to see the videos, that video is banned as well. This is not ok. This needs to be fixed. Thank you for your time.
title: Page Takedowns and Shadowbans

review:
I‚Äôve seen too many creators that mind their business get banned for no good reason, meanwhile videos that ACTUALLY break the community guidelines blow up. Also, the restrictions on account under 16 is the dumbest setting alive. You can‚Äôt even allow friends to save and share your videos, which means your account is on lockdown until you‚Äôre 16. They could literally not let you use certain app features for accounts UNDER 13, not 16. Dumbest thing alive if you ask me.

However, I will say that it‚Äôs mostly a very funny app (depending on what ends up on your for you page) And it‚Äôs very easy to get attention for things you like doing, such as editing, drawing, singing, etc (that also sort of falls under my point that tik tok boosts the wrong type of videos, given its the videos with real talent that get around 13K likes, meanwhile a video stolen from another app gets 300k+) I think people will definitely get attached to this app, but I also feel that these points still apply. Tik Tok is very entertaining yes, but I wish the mods did a better job at banning the right people and restricting minors from getting exposed to inappropriate junk.

review: Back in 2018, when TikTok blew up, I downloaded Ironically as a joke since it seemed like one of those apps that just got my attention as I never downloaded an app like it before. Unlike Musically, the app explored so much more than just girls singing or dancing to a song. The app explored what other creators had to show. Including the duet feature which blew up a ton gave the opportunity for people to interact or react with the TikTok video they were dueting. I have known about TikTok even before it blew up and downloaded it when it did. I had this app ever since and the possibility of it being taken down in the United States worries me. This app is my to-go app for entertainment and it has made me go through so many emotions throughout the years. Leaving this review is one of the few little things I could do to support not taking down TikTok. I hope that later on the future that this app is still up and running and will continue to make me and others what we have been feeling throughout its time in our life, our favorite.

review: I‚Äôve been on this app for almost four years now and, though I love the new transitions. There are many downsides about this app now. It is harder to store privates. Not just leave them. Bring back private messaging to people outside of friends. More people could be the option to make more friends. I noticed that most of the filters were taken away and the ones that stayed were not some of the best ones.  Bing back all the filters. It makes people be able to express their emotions better. Now, my biggest problem is with the gay flag. Why did you change it? You should not take away a flag that many people use to represent them. People shouldn‚Äôt be bothered by the gay flag now. It‚Äôs 2018. If a person doesn‚Äôt like gays, they can just not look at the accounts with people of the lgbtq+ community or leave this app. People can love who they want. title: Not Very Happy

review:
Tiktok keeps systematically taking down peoples accounts for no apparent reason with no explanation and those accounts are disproportionately from people of marginalized groups. While pedophiles, racists, homophobes, etc. get to have massive platforms, there are young black activists getting de-platformed who don‚Äôt even curse much less do anything sinister or worth punishment. There is genuinely no reason for them to be banned yet they are.

On top of this, there are frequent platform-wide glitches where everyone‚Äôs views seem to drop to zero as well as their followers, following, likes, etc. After these glitches people will have followers removed and sometimes the information the algorithm uses for your fyp resets so people are forced to watch videos they don‚Äôt like or care about. Furthermore, the app as a whole is incredibly inaccessible. Video editing features are difficult to use. Sounds may not always work. The auto caption feature (which hasn‚Äôt even finished its roll out yet) isn‚Äôt even accurate and highlights blatant discrimination within the app by censoring words like ‚Äúasian women‚Äù and critiques of white supremacy are consistently bastardized. For example, someone may say ‚Äúwe shouldn‚Äôt use eurocentric teaching in schools‚Äù and the captions will read ‚Äúwe should use afrocentric teaching in schools.‚Äù

title: Just fix itüôÑ

review: First of all, this app is super fun! I have a public account with about 35 fans, but there are many issues and glitches in the way the app works. My first issue is that there is a certain algorithm to the report system, so if people who don‚Äôt like a person go through and report that person‚Äôs videos, they get taken down almost automatically. Which is unfair to the creator, when the person could have just used the ‚ÄòNot Interested‚Äô button. A suggestion on how to make this better is that you could make it so that the ‚ÄòNot Interested‚Äô button is more visible, or that when someone reports a video, the staff at TikTok have to watch it and make sure it‚Äôs ok. Another issue is that you have to have 1000 fans to go live, and that lives can easily be shadow banned for no reason, causing it to be extremely difficult to interact with their fans. An example of how to fix this would be to make the shadow-banning shorter, and have a moderator on the live at all times.  Thanks for reading! TikTok is a great app, and these were just a few suggestions to make it better. üòÅ
title: Good app, but many problems to address.

review: TikTok is a great app that allows people to make short, fun videos and a chance to go viral. But, there should be a few changes. For one, there should be a filter in the comments that doesn‚Äôt allow nasty comments. In addition, there should be some separation in the videos that you‚Äôve previously liked. For example, there could be sections within the Liked Videos section, including To be Shared, and a separation between recently liked videos and videos that you liked a long time ago. You should also be able to filter   through your liked videos by searching the creator, the sound, or the description/ hashtags. Finally, in addition to the For You section and the Following section, there should be a (Fill in) Genre section. For example, if you are looking for videos specifically on baking, you could be able to choose a genre from a slide down menu and see videos on that topic. So, although TikTok is a great app, there should be a few more features on the next update.

I went on my backup acc and was also able to see my content and my account. Also, every time I try to log in, I have to reset my password because it‚Äôs ‚Äúincorrect‚Äù. How does that make sense if I changed it already and somehow the new one is incorrect?! Like what am I supposed to put. I‚Äôm not trying to be rude to the app or anything but I feel like this is genuinely wrong for them to do. There are so many accounts that post inappropriate content and that bully/harass others and yet nothing is done to take away their platform. But somehow I get banned for doing absolutely nothing wrong. I need answers and I need to know if this is just a glitch or something because this is ridiculous.
title: Ima need some answers.

review: TikTok is my happy place, I just got it when all this COVID-19 mess started because my sister kept sending me videos and she knew all of the bad news was affecting me because I‚Äôm a news fanatic, I don‚Äôt post anything but I scroll through and I laugh and I think about learning one of the dance videos. TikTok has subject matter that interest anyone of any age, you can select the types of content that you want to see. I always thought it was for kids and never gave it any thought but whenever I‚Äôm feeling down, I can look at precious babies doing the cutest things or I can watch someone with a beautiful voice sing, or I can laugh at comedy skits and pranks, watch my now favorite chefs whom I never would have known existed and then the TikTokers who just motivate and share love during this hard times we are experiencing in 2020, it‚Äôs been an unforgettable year but TikTok has definitely made it a happy place for this old woman.  I‚Äôm still stuck working from home but this app has given me something to smile about everyday! Thank You TikTok.
title: The Happy App

review: I‚Äôve had Tiktok for two years and it‚Äôs decent. It picks up on interests very easily. Some of the things are how hard it is to make an account, why they changed user ages 13-15 to private and give them no reach, and the ‚Äúyou are tapping too fast, take a break!‚Äù functions. It is very difficult to make a new account and try to transfer that email. You cannot change your age at all, so if you accidentally chose the wrong year it gives a disadvantage in reach. Also, the 13-15 age rule is to protect younger peoples safety but it might danger it. Yes, the intent was clear to protect young people 13‚Äì15 but then they will lie about their age, inflicting more harm. Not to notice that the age minimum for this app is 12+. People want to go on here for two things: fun or famous. I personally like both but putting my age as 15 on their has eliminated my opportunity to have videos on the ‚Äúfor you‚Äù page and make new, safe, online friends. The ‚Äútapping too fast‚Äù feature is useless because people will just go onto another social media. In conclusion, Tiktok has many flaws concerning email changes, minor protection and their like feature but otherwise it is my go to social media for being bored and constantly scrolling.

review: I want to start by saying, when I got this app, I liked it. The videos made me laugh, and there were some incredible and really talented people on the app. But eventually, I started seeing videos that I didn‚Äôt want to see. Some were inappropriate, others were just mean. Those videos did not ‚Äúmake my day‚Äù they ruined it! I wish you were able to control the videos that show up in your feed on this app. The only other thing I have to complain about is that I signed up when I was 13, but, even though this is a 12+ app, when I got my new account, it was basically... idk... the kind that young kids would have. What I mean is, while on a normal tiktok account, you could post videos, edit your profile, etc. but on the account I was given, after I entered in my birthday, you couldn‚Äôt post a video, or use the search feature. And your profile picture was this stupid panda that you couldn‚Äôt change. So I had to delete that account and change my birthday so that I could actually do stuff. I guess that ‚Äúchild‚Äù account would be good for people under 10 but this app is 12+ and I was 13. Aside from the issues, this is a fun app.
title: Fun app but...

review: TikTok is by far my favourite platform and the one I use the most but there are some issues the creators of this app need to address. First of all, TikTok has shown a pattern of silencing and shadowbanning LGBT and POC users while continuing to promote straight, white people who literally just stand there and act sexually. It‚Äôs completely unfair to people who try hard to put out entertaining and original content. My second point is that there needs to be a better way to separate people by age, I know some kids will lie about their age but I feel there should be some sort of system to help block children from finding the explicit content that will sometimes appear on this app. Lastly, I believe this app would be more interesting and appealing if there were some cool personalisation features. Maybe being able to customise a theme for your page or change the colour of the buttons on the app. Definitely not as serious as my other points but still something I‚Äôd love to see. Aside from the few negatives I listed and some that I probably don‚Äôt know about, I love this app a lot. It‚Äôs an easy and simple way to show creativity and inspire others.
title: I Have A Few Criticisms

review:
Where do I start? From evidence showing that TikTok execs purposefully choose videos of people with European features and who are not ‚Äòfat‚Äô, to allowing intolerant videos that are racist, sexist, homophobic, anti-LGBT, etc. to stay up while banning accounts or deleting videos of people who respond to these and air their grievances about these ignorant videos. Now, with the recent murder of George Floyd, TikTok has seemingly deleted all videos that are under the hashtags: ‚Äògeorgefloyd‚Äô ‚Äòjusticeforgeorgefloyd‚Äô and ‚Äòblacklivesmatter‚Äô. Not only that, but they have shadowbanned NUMEROUS Black TikTok users because of their activism. 

It saddens me that some Black people still use TikTok, but I know they use it as a platform to spread acceptance and to uplift the Black LGBT+ community, as well as the Black community overall. TikTok, your platform is huge. It is everywhere. Thousands of videos are shared from your platform every single day. You need to better as a platform, or else the entirety of the Black users on TikTok will stop using your app, and then you will see how great Black TikTokers and Black influencers are. I guarantee that the number of hits your platform receives each day will astronomically decrease. 

Do better by the group that has brought you all so many clicks and hits and brought many users to your app.
title: Discriminatory App

review:
This is a great app, lots potential. However, there‚Äôs no clear reason behind why some users videos get taken down while others with similar content are allowed to stay up. It‚Äôs been rumored that TikTok removes content of POC while others are allowed to post with immunity or contest Under Reviews  with success. When stating reasons why a user feels like their video was removed unfairly, there is no response to them other than, it‚Äôs removed or not. There is no human factor. If it‚Äôs done by automation then what is the REAL reason? I‚Äôve had ppl do tests and it seems that if your lighting is bright, the app allows it to stay. So if you appear fair-skin, you have a better chance of being seen and the video staying up.
Several users are in underwear that happened to be White are allowed over 100K views but POC do the exact same video and will be hit with a violation strike/account ban and vice versa.

We, the TikTok Community, knows that the creators of the app favor ppl like Addison Rae, Chase Hudson, & Charli D‚ÄôAmelio. This is your base. It also proves another point. You know what it is, you know what‚Äôs wrong.

review: I tried. I got almost 300k followers, I posted steady content, I was growing making money from the creator fund. Now here‚Äôs the kicker. Tiktok will randomly shadowban you, suspend your account, take down videos, and all without explanation. They even go so far to reinstate some of these videos... just to say you violated guidelines again and ban you entirely from the creator fund. The support center doesn‚Äôt respond at all. Most ‚Äúcontact tiktok‚Äù emails or whatever‚Äôs don‚Äôt get responded to. If you have to many people following or liking your content it‚Äôs gonna get u banned. If you don‚Äôt post regularly. title: It‚Äôs a interesting topic

review:
Dear app developers,

As a social site it is the very simplest of understanding that the idea is to be social. Social media is an idea that people who may have a vast set of differences can find similarities in spite of. Similarities that can bring a smile, start a trend, share an idea, invoke a thought to those we may never have the courage to meet on the street. You are not that site. You have used the ‚Äúidea‚Äù of social media to gain a name for yourselves yet you have never had the intention of being social. You stifle the voices and content of young black creators and now you have censored an entire community and those who seek to support said community. You are flawed. You are an issue. You are a misrepresentation of what social media‚Äôs intention. It is my greatest wish that every minority conducts a mass exit from your app. All that creativity shouldn‚Äôt be culture jacked at your whim. It is my sincere prayer that when that mass exit does happen you‚Äôd be left with an unseasoned mess. In closing, please stop using my little brothers and sisters as advertisement to display some sense of equality that we know you don‚Äôt display. That token negro on the profile pic scheme is played out.
Miracles and blessings! #blm just in case you don‚Äôt get it sense you censored it #Blacklivesmatter

title: Amazing! but some suggestions!

review:
I love TikTok. It really helps me pass the time, and I think it‚Äôs something unique from other social media apps. However, there are two things I would like to see changed. 
1) My main problem is with phone numbers. We should be able to delete our phone number. I got a new phone number recently, and I wanted to delete my old one and add my new one, but I couldn‚Äôt because TikTok kept saying that I have to verify my old number first (which I can‚Äôt because I don‚Äôt have my old number anymore). I really think that adding an option to just DELETE our phone number would be really helpful, because I‚Äôve seen others having this problem as well. 
2) Another problem is with the number of views. I have a good amount of followers, and I used to get hundreds and even thousands of views, but now I‚Äôm lucky if I even get 100 views. My content has stayed the same, but I just stopped getting on the For You page. I‚Äôve seen other creators (both large and small) having this issue as well. 
Those are my two concerns. Otherwise, it‚Äôs a great app!
title: A good app, but needs some improvements

review: I love tik tok so much and it‚Äôs been getting me through quarantine. It took me awhile to like it due to my strong love for Vine, but now i‚Äôm hooked. However, I have a great suggestion that I think would improve the quality of Tik Tok. Not that it doesn‚Äôt get enough success, but I just think this would create more popularity. I strongly believe that their should be a ‚ÄúRepublish‚Äù button for each Tik Tok created. This way, accounts can republish their all time favorite Tik Toks to their page just like Twitter profiles can ‚ÄúRetweet‚Äù their favorite tweets to their page. The Save button is great for private favorites that you want to go back to or love, and the Like button is great to give some love to a Tik Tok that is entertaining. A Republish button would benefit all types of accounts. Meaning, even if an account doesn‚Äôt make Tik Toks themselves or isn‚Äôt ‚ÄúTik Tok Famous‚Äù, they would still be able to make their account page creative by Republishing their all time favorite Tik Toks!!! This would help the interaction between accounts. Please consider this!!!! It would be fantastic.
title: Tik Tok Tip

review: As a gay, mixed, female (many minorities mixed) I have always had a hard time throughout school and even with social media... I felt like nobody really liked me. My goal and dream has always been to make as many people smile and have a good day as I can because I know what it‚Äôs like to feel down and out. TikTok has given me such a feeling of euphoria knowing that I‚Äôve done exactly that! Blowing up over night basically and now when I go out people recognize me.. I feel so honored to even be apart of this amazing experience. I was a musically user so TikTok was always up my ally... did I expect to be anywhere near as popular as I am right now? OF COURSE NOT! But I‚Äôm am so thankful that I can make my mark on the world! So again thank you!!! Awesome app 5 stars!! Only problem I ever had was being reported as underage while on livestream, however; a quick appeal and I was back in about 20 hours! I‚Äôd give this app 20 stars if I could - so again thank you for allowing me to make my mark!

review:
This is probably going to be long, so I apologize for that. 

I understand this app is 13+. There are definitely a lot of kids on this app, but there are also LOTS of adults. So many videos have been taken down because kids do not like videos that adults post. Most of the time, the videos aren‚Äôt even inappropriate. One that was taken down was a girl holding her dog....how is that bad enough to be taken down exactly? It seems like the ones running the app jus take down any video that‚Äôs reported without even looking at it. But I‚Äôve reported videos that ACTUALLY violate terms and they stay up. Why? .
I think a good update would be to add an 18+ update. I don‚Äôt mean make the whole app 18+, i mean to have it so that profiles can set an 18+ setting on their page so it only shows their videos to people who have put their birthday in and say they‚Äôre 18 or over. That way all ages can use the app and kids aren‚Äôt seeing anything inappropriate, and adults can post adult content (no nudity or anything, and without violating terms, obviously. But posts with cursing in it often get taken down). 
Also, shadowbanning needs to stop. So many good creators are losing views because the creators allow them to be shadow banned. Please consider everything I said. Thanks.

title: Lyric 1127

review: When I graduated from high school in 2012, I moved with my parents from our farm home in Sandy, Oregon, all the way to the Portland, Oregon. From that time up until about 3 months ago, my connection with friends and relatives was through the usual Facebook, insta, text and call, etc... But as the years go on, people come and people go at a rate that‚Äôs manageable. And as I started to near my 26th birthday, I found Tik Tok. At first of course I was reluctant, it seemed as though this was a child‚Äôs thing, and even perhaps I might be frowned upon for using such an app. But as time had gone by, and having seen people older than I as patrons on this platform, I grew  to the notion that maybe...just maybe, I can still act ‚Äòfoolish‚Äô. I can still dance, sing, hell I can even wear nice clothes and show it off. Tik Tok has offered me, interaction, for interactions, meaningful and passive alike, are needed very much in this world today. It‚Äôs akin to the internet being ‚Äòreinvented‚Äô, as it were, for me at least.
title: Interactions in the 21st century, (as seen through the eyes of Emanuel J. Dickinson)

title: Love but tire of being ‚Äúreviewed‚Äù

review: I was admittedly a little uneasy about the ‚Äúalgorithm‚Äù that determines content...heard a lot of fear-mongering about tictoc methodology before deciding to check it out myself. Does tictoc utilize various inputs to create your custom feed? Yes, and unlike most of the apps you already have, tictoc is very transparent about this feature. One thing we‚Äôve all learned from the covid madness is that data from our devices is constantly being mined or utilized by various entities, even when you think you‚Äôve ‚Äòturned off‚Äô all permissions. Tic toc is different in that it openly informs users about how they tap into data (as well as your preferences noted while on the app) to create an awesome endless array of content that is truly customizable to the user.  An unexpected feature for me is the access to information and videos that you‚Äôll never see in mainstream media. Only downside of this app is that it‚Äôs a bit addicting but they have actually taken steps to remind users that they‚Äôve been watching a while. Great app.
title: Love the personalized content

review: Ok so if you have been using TikTok for a while you would notice that if you are having a conversation with someone or many people in the comment section the replies get jumbled up each time you revisit the conversation making it harder for other people to understand the flow of the conversation. With the atmosphere of people being highly opinionated and unafraid to speak their mind on TikTok and in the comment section, I find it unacceptable that I can barely follow the flow of an argument that would have been meaningful if it wasn‚Äôt jumbled. With the milllions and millions of people using this app, this issue with the comment section is almost criminal. You have angry people speaking their mind, then when they attempt to argue with another person they can‚Äôt even understand each other confusing them both causing them to give up with increased angst. I rated this app four stars because I really do like it but I‚Äôm also being generous. Please for the sake of your users health fix this problem. You know how long people use this app for in one session.

review: this app is VERY mature and has a lot of explicit content. trends can be dangerous or inappropriate. i‚Äôd say tiktok shouldn‚Äôt ever be for anyone under the age of 14. although tiktok has a ‚Äúsaftey mode‚Äù, this doesn‚Äôt block out enough content. some trends include people encouraging girls to insert ice cubes into their privates, people walking in on their significant others naked, and many sexual dances, ‚ÄúPOV‚Äù‚Äôs and videos. parents, please be VERY mindful of your children‚Äôs activity on this app. it‚Äôs a great load of fun for an older audience, but although it was meant for younger people, it‚Äôs not. tiktok doesn‚Äôt block out most inappropriate content that i see and users have to be vary careful not to get on the wrong side of the app. when used safely by the appropriate age, it‚Äôs a great app. but parents of anyone under the age of 14-15 should NOT allow their kids to have this app. no matter what you hear about the ‚Äúsaftey features‚Äù, tiktok simply doesn‚Äôt block out inappropriate content. some content is good, like trends of women bringing eachother up, and acts of kindness. but there is also a lot of cruelty, hate, and inappropriate and toxic behaviors that just aren‚Äôt a good model for children.

title: Live issues

review:
First of all, TikTok is highly entertaining and an excellent creative outlet. Don't get me wrong, I love this app. But you, the developers, need to improve your algorithm and customer service. People have repeatedly had some of their videos banned for "violating community guidelines", and their appeals have been ignored. I am one of those people. Two of my videos were taken down despite having nothing explicit in them, and what's worse: Other users who post much more inappropriate things are completely untouched. I reported a guy for making unsettling pov's of a teacher flirting with a student, but he's fine. Meanwhile, my video condemning sexism in a particular audio that stated "Kill all men" was taken down. Plot twist: The audio is still available and people are still using it without consequence. 

Other users including (but not limited to) Onlyjayus, Cutiethiccums, and ElisTK have had similar issues. Please, fix your algorithm or at least be consistent. It's really quite infuriating. ElisTK quit using TikTok as a result, so if you don't improve you'll continue to lose users.

title: It‚Äôs okay I guess...

review: I have been on the app for a while now and I have noticed the amount of bullying increase dramatically in the past few months. Whether it is in the comment section or in a duet/reaction video, the amount of bullying on this app is atrocious. There are a few things that i have noticed that are aiding in this. First, an individual who is being bashed on the app, if they duet or react to the video to defend themselves, their reaction is commonly taken down and not the original video where the bashing occurs. This silences select people, which is wrong. Secondly, videos that are taken down that violate community guidelines, usually the sound is not taken down with it. There are many videos that i have seen where something offensive is being stated and the original video is nowhere to be seen. There are just copycat creators using it. There are younger members of the tik tok ‚Äúcommunity‚Äù the bullying i have seen can cause real issues. I understand there are protections for speech and the internet is hard to regulate, the company can do more to ensure that their users are in a position to be able to speak up for themselves.

After I became familiar with tiktoc , I became and I still am addicted . My only criticism is a lack of direction for those of us who are not naturally technologically literate . Provide better instructions on the exsisting special aeffects and video tools . I alive that any song you desire is available . I consider this one of a few ‚Äúhappy‚Äù times . my harmless vice of my day . However , many folks on and off TikToc make those us over 50 feel ashamed about experimenting with tic-tok. I love the app . I have so much fun , it forces you to rejuvenate creativity and boldness something many of us gave up on overtime . Thanks For the distraction especially during this HORRIFIC summer of Quarantine ‚ù§Ô∏èüî•

Unlike Facebook who actually reviews the reported video then decides if the video was in violation or not TickTock doesn‚Äôt. It‚Äôs almost like as soon as someone hits the report button TickTock automatically takes it down. This needs to be fixed it‚Äôs an issue amongst all users who enjoy this app. Especially when I‚Äôve come across some very inappropriate videos performed by the youth and those videos continue to appear on the for you page. title: Needs Improvement

review: My overall experience has been positive. Odd to say, but I've met some fantastic people through the app. I wasn‚Äôt expecting that but during a time where we had no social contact with others, I felt connected, creative and happy. I would give the app 5 stars, but their reporting processes need improvement. Currently it seems that initial reports must be monitored by bots because unfortunately if someone doesn‚Äôt like you for ANY reason, they can report a video for violating the guidelines- and often it doesn‚Äôt. Numerous false reports like this have allowed homophobia and racist accounts to shut down even wholesome accounts all together because mass reporting, and therefore mass ‚Äúviolations,‚Äù causes an account to be permanently banned - or your views all get halted for months. I would love to see only creator accounts (more than 10k followers) allowed to report and you‚Äôd be identified on who reported, so people had more to lose themselves by reporting and fake troll accounts couldn‚Äôt troll (ie not enough followers)
title: Don‚Äôt take it too seriously and you‚Äôll have fun.

review: Tiktok is a really fun app but some people on it are out of control. I use the app to express my creativity and have fun but some use it as their only fans. I'm a minor and I don't want to be scrolling through one of my favorite apps to see some of my favorite anime characters so sexualized. There's also a lot of racist people that call people names an there videos don't get taken down while informative videos on blm and issues in the world are taken down for violating community guidelines. Another thing is, the algorithm is kinda weird, I personally don't care about my likes and views but I have friends that are almost at 1m follows and their videos sometimes get only 100 likes so that's something to consider if you plan to make it big on the app. I'd recommend having a private account if you just want to use it for fun due to the amount of hate and bullying happens. Some of the larger creators on the app are very problematic and don't deserve their platform and their fans are cult like, if you say one bad thing about them prepare to get doxxed and threatened. I could go on and on, but tiktok is fun to use for creative purposes and to make friends take what you will from this.
title: Eh

review: Although this is a very fun app when it comes down to guidelines and rules, I TikTok is not professional when it comes to communicating why you may be in trouble. For example they banned my account from going live that specific live all I did was study for a class. I looked up on the Internet how long it should take them to review my appeal and Google said between 24 hours and three days. & it has almost been three months since they have yet to contact me and tell me why or let me know what is going on with the process. I am a little extra when it comes to professionalism so I went above and beyond and tried to contact the original creator of TikTok. The original creator of TikTok was a little hard to find in fact they give the impression that they don‚Äôt want to be found even if something were to be wrong with the app. They left no email and I had to do some research to even find a phone number and of course they do not speak the language that I speak so when I called they hung up on me. This is a big issue I have even heard about big constant creators being banned for a while before I TikTok realized who they were but it should not take this long to review an appeal it‚Äôs been almost 3 months.
title: TikTok thoughts

review: TikTok has been the best community over the past 2 years now. So many people have come together to share hobbies, interests, memes(wholesome or dark), and overall positivity. This doesn‚Äôt deserve to come to an end. I will miss this wonderful place so much, especially all the creators I love and cherish. Where will we go from here? I have no clue. I don‚Äôt think anyone does. And I know it will be several months before we find an entirely new platform, even if it‚Äôs one that starts out with the same attention that TikTok got in October 2018. God I love this community. This never deserved to happened. At least not this soon. I‚Äôve met amazing new friends, and even a couple partners from here. I loved all the experience I‚Äôve gotten in my life from them. Now, by November 12th, everything will be gone. Only the saved videos you have on your phone and all the meme compilations will remain. Let‚Äôs take what time we have left to show each other what this platform really means. Here‚Äôs to the future.

review: This app has the potential to be something truly amazing but has so many issues. It's main one being that it favors certain creators over others and pushes a certain kind of content or narrative to its users. It's a great app for creators and can be a very helpful tool for some if it weren't for the fact that in suppresses the majority of their content. It's become increasingly harder to get any views or interactions, and when people do follow you, they don't get shown any of the content these people are creating. It shadowbans people and takes down content that is usually wrongfully deemed "inappropriate" in some way and it's nearly impossible to submit an appeal to have it republished. I've been on this app for almost 4 years and I have a decent following but hardly any interaction because my content isn't being seen by the people who follow and isn't being put on the for you page. Not to mention it takes down harmless videos but allows dangerous, inappropriate, racist, homophobic and just generally harmful videos to stay up. With every update it gets worse and worse and there seems to be no end to the growing list of issues. You really need to do better tik tok

title: I love tiktok BUT

review: I love tiktok and how it brings people together, but it is unacceptable to me and others who use this app, that the team behind all of this (knowing this is a 12+ app) will allow nudity content (men‚Äôs parts specifically) even after it has been reported by a lot of people. What I speak of is now on a private account but it was once public and the video is still up. Here is the problem, people who spoke about about this were silenced by having their videos removed or having a week ban on their page. Tiktok has also been limiting and banning the content of black creators and spiritual creators as well, but not those who discriminate against others blatantly on their pages. Where is the balance? Keep all the nasty stuff, but block out those who are doing no harm? Take this review down to change your rating; that‚Äôs okay, I have copy pasted this and have videos saved from the app talking about and showing the obvious things you let slide! You have a lot of potential TikTok, buck up or someone is going to make a new platform out of spite and convince others to move on! title: Content regulation issues

review:
The app barely has any good content to offer, and almost all of it is some angsty teen who thinks they‚Äôre doing something funny but in reality it just makes people want to grab a knife and stab themselves. The community is out of hand. And don‚Äôt get me started with dangerous things people do. Enter TikTok challenges, where you try something that you think would be cool, and then you gather all your friends, you do it, and you feel pretty cool to be doing it, but then, after a few seconds, you realize that one person moves out of place or does something wrong. Say, that there was a challenge to form a pyramid with your friends. Now, slowly but surely, you tilt forward, then you crash on the ground. Keep in mind that some challenges can be individual. Also, the community is dumb enough to be doing this to themselves. It amazes me about how a person can be so dumb to be injuring themselves willingly trying to do something ‚Äòcool‚Äô. Why would you ever want to do that? Well, surely the 7 and 8 year olds have got you covered.

Oh yeah, this app is also stealing literally all your data, and is probably sending it to the Chinese Communist Party.

Well, that‚Äôs all she wrote for me. Bye, and farewell to this toxic app.

review: This app truly is becoming the next vine, so naturally I was thrilled to download this after seeing Pewdipie‚Äôs meme review on this app! However, the algorithm on the for you page is extremely bias towards the little guy, which is GREAT... until you hit 900 fans and they no longer feature your material on the for you page unless you‚Äôre either a verified ‚Äúpopular creator‚Äù or have old memes that have TONS of likes, PLEASE change this! As a creator with 900+ fans who probably don‚Äôt see me on their feed all the time because of all their other subscriptions, so it is hard to maintain a popular status with original content. Also, the videos should be reviewed before immediately being taken down, it really hurts the opinion of both the fans and the creators who are trying to enjoy original meme content and I fear that TIKTOK may lose creators and fans if this issue persists. However, I believe if TikTok stops marketing cringy apps while marketing some of their original creators memes and changes the other two problems previously mentioned, their western fan base will continue to grow!

review:
My son began a company about a year ago, a clothing brand called ‚Äúunxpectd‚Äù. Two months ago, he and 7 friends, moved from Lexington, KY to Los Angeles, CA, in pursuit of a dream. Their success exponentially grew when they started their TikTok account ‚Äúunxpectd house‚Äù.

He works 18 hour days and with the time difference, I only get to talk to him a couple times a week. I am so thankful for TikTok. Every day, when I finish surgical cases, I tune in to ‚Äúunxpectd house‚Äù to watch these guys live, laugh and create.  They want to motivate the youth of today to never give up, to pursue their dreams.... no matter where you are from or with what little you start.

Thank you for providing a remarkable, ‚Äúunxpectd‚Äùway to provide my daily reassurance that my son is safe, happy, and healthy!!! Keep up the great work with your site!! TikTok is influencing so many lives.  My story, as a Mom whose 19 year old son now lives 2,200 miles away, is a small testimony of the connections and impact your company provides!!

review: TikTok is a platform that has continuously showed preference for predominantly white content. It has also supported racist content by allowing certain trends linked to police brutality, lynching and slavery to go Viral without any repercussions on the users. They have now also token a clear stance by limiting content standing for injustice and blatant murder of black individuals in the US. Considering the fact that black people gave them the platform they have today (yes GAVE them, from actual creators, promoting videos on other platforms and just serving as an ‚ÄúInspiration‚Äù (with no credit) for other groups‚Äô content) and yet they clearly do not support our struggles. A platform that supports racism, police brutality and actions of hate is a platform that should be revoked and have no place in society. I am disappointed and appalled at their current stance and am sure they will realize the mistake they have done once the largest influencing culture in the US abandons their platform.

review:
I absolutely love TikTok but the problem I have, is with the disabling of direct messaging for people under 16, which just got enforced. Since there are already settings on who can direct message the user, and users can block each other, hate speech and inappropriate activity shouldn‚Äôt be much of an issue. I think that it is also a good idea to advocate online safety on the app so things like direct messaging can be promoted and used more appropriately. That being said, I completely understand why the restriction exists, but if you guys want to keep it I suggest maybe reducing the limit to 14 yrs instead of 16 yrs, because users that are at least 14 should be able to be responsible with direct messages. If this is an app for teenagers, all teenagers should be able to use the direct messaging. Family pairing and things of that nature should be a choice. Restrictions should not be automatic. Thank you for listening and I wish well for this app and this company. 

- Julianna
title: Great app but why the DM restrictions?

review:
I first downloaded TIK TOK last September in 2018 and everything was fine. I made videos, got followers, got likes, the usual. Up til February, I had about 150 followers, 160 videos, and 300 likes! Then there was a new update on the app, so I updated it. Then when I went on the app - it asked me to fill in my password, age, email, etc. to verify myself (bc of the security update) so I did.
But then when I went to my profile page.... IT WAS BLANK, COMPLETELY BLANK!!!!!!! 
MY VIDEOS WERE GONE!!!!! SO WERE MY FOLLOWERS AND LIKES!!!! I reported the problem, and they did nothing! So I asked a few of my friends about and they said that nothing like this has ever happened to them before, but I heard it has happened to many other people before!! My friends said that I was probably hacked, I was shocked ( considering that I had a private account) 
So I deleted the app and warned a few of my younger friends not to download it.
It might happen to you, so be careful when you download this app.

I‚Äôm not a furry but this app portrays them as the enemy since most of them are gamers, and this makes people think about doing verbally or even PHYSICALLY bad things to them and it negatively affects their mental mind. This even happens to kids and can lead to a unhealthy mindset and can ruin their future career if they want to draw art that they love. This is really not good for a developing brain, and I want to let all of you furries and gamers that furries are people too. If you don‚Äôt like furries or anything about them, then don‚Äôt say anything negative about them online! You need to think about possible consequences and reconsider it. But back to the topic, Yes it is a place for creative people to inspire younger ones,but keep in mind it can also do some damage to someone‚Äôs brain mentally if they are being bullied online. I have wanted to let you all know that think before you act and don‚Äôt bully. Good day and be safe online.

title: TikTok is amazing

review:
My opinions solely as a viewer/consumer, not a creator!!!! TikTok has good content, easy ways to share content with friends, and the FYP algorithm is sometimes scarily accurate to link you to people with the same niche interests. I think TikTok really needs to improve its reporting functions bc there is definitely some sketch and hate speech content being allowed to exist on the app. Otherwise, it's a lot of fun even as someone who doesn't participate in trends or make videos.  

One of my biggest pet peeves is the missing function to copy or follow links from within the TikTok app. For example, if an artist I follow has a link to their store from their profile, I can open the link within TikTok BUT there is no way for me to directly open the link in Chrome/Safari or even to copy the URL to save and open elsewhere. This is very frustrating bc it has led to a lot of dead-end searches and is a lot of extra work to type out and search specific link URL's outside the app. Reallt hope TikTok can update this feature soon.
title: Good app with suggestions

review:
I do love TikTok but there are several items that need to be addressed to improve the app. Minor issue number one, when I go to my Favorites and search for a specific creator, the search often does not work but if I scroll through the several hundred people I am following, I can manually locate them, please fix this. Second minor issue, sometimes I accidentally refresh the feed and lose track of where I am and miss out on videos, I feel the refresh could be handled differently. Finally, and this is a big one, TikTok needs to get their AI under control and start being more consistent with their banning. There are people actually threatening creators and they are not being banned, there are people who are reporting content because they don‚Äôt like it and getting creators banned, there is content being reported that TikTok states ‚Äúviolates guidelines‚Äù when it does not. 
TikTok, you‚Äôve got serious work to do. You need to ban creators who put out actual aggressive/misogynistic/rapey content and ban people who repeatedly report content that doesn‚Äôt actually violate guidelines!

All of the discrimination is kept and doesn‚Äôt break community guidelines. Creators of color break community guidelines for posting about their daily lives, though other people can freely share whatever they please. If you ever comment on someone‚Äôs video you will always be bombarded by people threatening you. Even the creators on tiktok will get death threats and other horrible things. I myself have been harassed on the app and I only ever posted a single video of my dog sleeping. 
In my own opinion based on the things I have seen on the app, the abuse and hate on tiktok is far worse than what you see on instagram. Tiktok will not ban those who threaten others, they do absolutely nothing about it. Instead they ban those who speak up about the abuse. 
Silencing those who are threatened and abused will only make the fire burn hotter.

title: The update:(

review: tiktok has been incorrectly flagging and deleting marginalized creator's videos, especially ones concerning their own marginalization. they will even completely ban marginalized users for violating community guidelines that were never violated in these videos in the first place, and then refuse to restore their account. tiktok's team does all of this for absolutely no reason i can discern besides promoting a particularly disturbing agenda or for monetary gain. this is blatant censorship. it's to the point where if marginalized users even speak out on the incorrect flagging of their videos, they most certainly will be banned. it's absurdly common on tiktok for marginalized creators to have multiple accounts because even just by making content on this app, you're likely to get at least 1 account banned. of course, if you aren't lgbt, bipoc, or disabled, your videos are a lot more likely to find success on tiktok. if you are, even if you create the most wholesome kid-friendly content, you're A LOT more likely to end up shadowbanned. this disgusting behavior needs to stop. we need to normalize holding these social media empires accountable for their reprehensible biases.
title: tiktok silences marginalized voices and refuses to address it

review:
1.  I think bringing back the "near me" tab would be great for smaller creators to get more exposure due to the fact it doesn't matter if they're popular or not, it's based on location.
2. I (& I'm sure many other creators) favorite videos that give them ideas. It would be super helpful if we had playlists that allowed us to organize our favorites into categories. 
3. I know the FYP is based on an algorithm that shows us videos that YOU think we will enjoy, but another way to show us videos we'll enjoy as well as finding creators we have things in common with is being able to follow hashtags. 
4. Small creators should be able to go live, just because a creator isn't "famous" doesn't mean they shouldn't be able to connect with their followers. 
5. Expand the limitation of characters when commenting. We can't always message a creator questions or advice, especially if they're famous. The number of times I've had to reply to myself just to finish what I'm saying & it then get lost in a pool of replies of other people is rather frustrating. 
6. Add a dislike button. This will allow viewers to simply say they don't like the video without it coming across as bullying or being rude, or subjecting the viewer to other's opinions when they comment. It was also give the creator a better look at how well a video is doing because it's hard to see every comment made & properly judge the video.

review: The overall concept is great but the experience of actively engaging is more annoying than it needs to be.  TERRIBLE moderation; everyone I follow has had at least one or two videos taken down or have been actively suppressed, or even get live streams cut off for very minor offenses if any at all, whereas some more harmful content I‚Äôve seen stitched at least three times and probably reported a hundred more before ever taken down.  Video editing interface is not the smoothest either and could probably use features like an ‚Äúundo‚Äù button or toggle buttons to make adjusting durations of effects easier especially on longer videos.  And the app is slow to give all of its users new features it rolls out, leaving most users to discover them on accident, whereas most apps/programs would probably include new features in an update that everyone can engage.  I hope Tik Tok sees this because they have much to address before frustrated creators begin to actually leave the app for other platforms.

review:
I find it very impractical that you have to connect your phone number to an account in order to send messages. I find it even more ridiculous that you can only have your phone number linked to 1 account. Any other social media will allow you to use the same phone number for multiple accounts. Without knowing this, I linked my phone number to a shared account for my friend and I (which I will most likely not be messaging on). I would have to delete the shared account *and then* wait 30 days for the account to permanently delete in order to link my phone number to my personal account, to be able to message other users. I definitely think there could‚Äôve been a better way to approach this, and that this is an issue that should be looked at and resolved. 

Aside from that, however, I do find myself on this app for hours at a time. The content makes me laugh and I appreciate that. I only wish that I could respond to my friends who have sent me posts on my personal account. Or even share content with them.

review:
I can not believe you guys banned #blacklivesmatter and all it‚Äôs other variations, including #georgefloyd. As a platform as large and widespread as you are, you should be lending a hand to all that‚Äôs been happening in the world. Instead, you prevent these tagged to be spread across millions of accounts, who are trying to inform others and keep people safe. 

Why? To protect the kids of their innocence? To not let the 4 and 5 year olds to see all the chaos in the world, when your app states you have to be 13 years or older to use it? The exact same age- might I add- you have to be to use Instagram; and even there, tags and chains of stories are being spread like wildfire. Mounds of information being spread on how to keep people safe, what to do if you‚Äôll be protesting, details on people who have gone missing and arrested during these times- and you have the AUDACITY to prevent people from using these tags, for what? 

Any excuse or reason you make will never amount to the disappointment you‚Äôve caused behalf of everyone who has fought to be heard, and the ones who are still fighting to be seen. This is completely unacceptable and you know it. I‚Äôm in utter disgust with your actions. #justiceforfloyd

A lot of the videos people make don‚Äôt have any captions because it takes a while to get the text at the right time and also to remember what you said, often taking a good 5 minutes just to add CC. So I think it would be really nice for users to have the option to have provided subtitles that you can turn on and off in the users settings, which would also correspond with the users language choice. This action would be a great help with people who have hearing problems and either can‚Äôt hear what the song is saying or what the person on screen is. I personally don‚Äôt suffer from any hearing problems but I still would like to supportive of the deaf community. I also personally don‚Äôt know how much it would cost, if any, but I still hope this can be added soon.

review: I like this app. I use it almost every day, and I like what you can do on it. But, I have a few things that I want to bring up. For one, you are ‚Äúshadowbanning‚Äù certain accounts. Most of those accounts are LGBT+ and/or POC. Care to explain that? You post about how Black Lives Matter, but you give white creators more attention. You also don‚Äôt give small accounts much attention at all. What‚Äôs up with that? Also, videos often get taken down for ‚Äúviolating community guidelines‚Äù even when those videos in fact do not violate any guidelines. Yet you don‚Äôt bother taking down videos that actually do violate your guidelines. Also also, sometimes I will be watching a video, and it will have very few, if any, comments/likes. Yet when I go to that creator‚Äôs page and select that same video, there are suddenly many more comments and likes. Again, why is that? Going back to my point about videos being taken down without good reason, most if the videos being taken down are LGBTQ+ and/or POC. These videos often speak out of issues happening in our society. Get it together, TikTok.

review: I downloaded TikTok with the idea that it would be a good environment and fun. I wanted to have something that me and my kids could love. Instead of TikTok being a good environment it was far from that. On this app there is a lot of misinformation and hatred that kids can easily pick up on. I removed the app from my phone, so my kids won‚Äôt feel bad about how they look and won‚Äôt learn hate. There are people on this app spreading misinformation about things like the pandemic, the election, etc. There is also a lot of hate speech on this app. Depending on your looks, content against the guidelines will be ignored no matter how much you report the post. When it comes to hate speech some is ignored while other are instantly punished. These actions from the people behind this app, give people the idea that hate speech is okay to do to one group of people, but not another. On this app many creators are being denied their accounts back or views for doing something that isn‚Äôt against the guidelines, while others who do the same thing and are completely ignored all on the basis of looks. If you want your kids to learn how to be shallow and insecure, this is the app for you.

review: Honestly, I like the part where people of all ages get together and relate, but some teens abuse the platform and completely neglect duties such as school, possibly work, and spending time with family. People can talk about dirty things such as s*x, p**n, private areas, smoking, d**gs, etc. Viewers can spend hours scrolling which can cause loss of memory and waste time. It is also a toxic platform where children are exposed to harmful ideas and harmful people (Charli and Peaches). The privacy policy is also ‚Äúastronomical‚Äù as TikTok‚Äôs headquarters is in China and it is a Chinese company. They are allowed to view pictures, videos, messages, and personal information on your phone and save the data without you posting any of it. Also according to law in China, all the information must go to the government of China, which is pretty scary and ridiculous. Overall, I believe I should be giving it a 1.5 due to its privacy policy and effect on growing teens. Also, I am not a Karen, I am a ( [an]almost)teen who cares more about school than scrolling mindlessly through an app all day while China‚Äôs GDP goes through the roofs.

review: The application TikTok has been identified as a national security threat to the United States from China and as of now the United States Department if Defense has banned its use by United States government employees and United States military personnel. Any photographs or video taken on these phones or by this application will be sent back to the Chinese government so if you have this application on your phone you should delete it immediately and if you have one of these Chinese cell phones you should purchase a different brand phone, delete all information from your Chinese made phone, ensure all data, including cloud data and sensitive personal information has been erased as well and once that has been completed you should remove the phones SIM card and then burn both the phone and that SIM card.

review: At first Tik Tok seems great. Humor, life hacks, dancing. But the more you watch the worse it gets. People who speak the truth and try to raise awareness about certain issues get their posts flagged and taken down because the video ‚Äúgoes against community guidelines.‚Äù Meanwhile there‚Äôs literal children posting inappropriate content and then being sexualized by people of all ages in the comments, and those things continue to stay up. There‚Äôs honestly a lot of very awful things on this app that not everyone wants to (or should) see. There‚Äôs also a lot of bullying on this app. If you read the comments on just about any video there‚Äôs always something negative. Usually it‚Äôs attacking someone‚Äôs appearance, which can be very detrimental to some users. And although a user can turn the comments off they shouldn‚Äôt have to fear being bullied online for making a post. On top of all this they're trying to silence the BLM community by banning their hashtags. Tik Tok is definitely discriminatory towards a lot of different people, and the longer you‚Äôve had the app the more you start to notice.  Tik Tok needs to get it together because its priorities are clearly not straight.

review: I love the app, and though learning how to film and edit does have a learning curve, it‚Äôs still one of the best, most efficient editing programs for quick videos. However, one thing that frustrates me, and that I Hope will change with future updates, is the inability to continue filming / continue shooting once you move onto the ‚Äúediting‚Äù portion. If you move onto the editing portion, trim a clip, then want to go back and film an additional clip, you can‚Äôt. Your trimmed edit will NOT be saved, so if you were trying to trim a section to be able to have space to film a new clip, you can‚Äôt. This is particularly frustrating if you filmed most of the video a day or two ago, and want to trim some clips, and go back and film some new clips to add to it. You can‚Äôt. You receive the error message that ‚Äúcontinuing shooting will erase all edits‚Äù but, there‚Äôs no way to trim a clip during the initial filming process either! You‚Äôre screwed either way! Trimming clips and adding new clips to a saved draft is a must in this app, when most videos rely on transitions that may be filmed days or weeks apart from one another.
title: Continue Filming

review: The concept of Tik Tok is great. Letting people express their creativity, whether it be in the form of comedic jokes, cosplay, or art is a great idea. That‚Äôs supposed to be the concept, but thats not how its played out. Recently, Tik Tok has changed the algorithm to where its really only popular content creators that show up on the for you page and in the hash tags. Small accounts can‚Äôt compare and their content gets hidden by a shadowban, which is the process of putting a suspension on your account without you knowing. You can continue to post videos and comments, but rarely will they ever be seen. In order to get on the for you page, it needs to seem like you‚Äôre chasing clout, whether thats stealing someone‚Äôs content, doing something incredibly stupid, or looking cute. Only sometimes will you see original ideas produced by small accounts that get the views they deserve, other then that, its the same popular creators. It would be nice to see a change. It would be nice to see the shadowban disappear and the for you page include more small creators so that they can be discovered for their talents as well.  Also, the customer service is awful, that needs fixed.

review:
The funny thing about tiktok is that its not just an app. Its not just a place where you can watch funny videos of people falling down or dogs reacting to triggering sounds. Its a place where the outcasts, the forgot, the overlooked, and ones even close to death can find a home. Its a place where you can be a as creative and/or as crazy as you wanna be. This is a place where no matter what, you are excepted. Where you can be you no matter what anyone thinks. Its a place where, no matter how young or inexperienced you are, you CAN be heard! This app has saved peoples lives. This app has brought people home. The best friendship and longest relationships have been made on this app. People who were not able to get a job (for whatever reason) now have something that can kickstart them and get them back on their feet.
Tiktok is not just an app, it‚Äôs a home. Our followers are not just random boys and girls, they‚Äôre our family. 
Thank you. <3
