review:
Wow. I never knew you could go to silly Musically, to awesome TikTok.

SAFETY / PRIVACY. When I first got Musically, I thought one thing: Private. Account. Now. The programing for Musically privacy was ehh. The programing for TikTok with privacy was incredibly done. You just send requests to people you want to follow who have private accounts, and vice versa. Nobody can just look you up, and look at your posts/videos. My only doubt about TikTok is: You could look up a famous person on TikTok, and follow them, and chances are they don't have a private account. So you can look at whatever they post publicly. But overall, it's one of the best apps for children, teens, or even adults with the best privacy and safety. (Think about it as Instagram for a "kinder") When you put your age, it has a range. What I mean is that there is a "For You" area where you look at posts that might interest the age put in, so if you are say 11 years old, it will only show appropriate content.

review: When it comes to dancing, singing, and comedic videos, we all know Tiktok is chock full of it. But my problem with this app lies in the fact that whenever a serious event is happening in the world and people are making informative videos about them in real time, Tiktok picks a side on whichever topic is being talked about and takes down or suppresses videos. I first noticed this when it came to BLM, but I thought it was just the algo being weird, but then it started to suppress videos on AAPI. My final straw was when recently, I‚Äôve been seeing a number of videos concerning what‚Äôs going on in Sheikh Jarrah with the Palestinians. Any and every video I‚Äôve seen about Palestine I‚Äôve seen on this app came from either people I follow on the following tab or I have to search them up myself. Not once have I seen any on my FYP. But I have seen a number of IDF supporters. Same with Trump supporters, or just generally racist content. This is the most irresponsible thing I can think of a huge app like Tiktok doing, because there is so much traffic through this app daily. This is just incredibly disappointing, either show everyone‚Äôs videos or show no ones.
title: Chooses Sides In Important Situations

review: This is an amazing app! I have grown so much and have even earned some new friends. Despite this, I still have suggestions. First off, you should be able to use the same emails or phone numbers for different accounts, but it would still need to be confirmed. I had to make several emails just for separate accounts., but I am still not able to talk to my followers. Second, better security. Sometimes people get banned for unreasonable things or for no reason at all. Reports don‚Äôt really work either. Even if they do, it should take multiple of the same reason/similar reason to be able to ban someone. Not just one. Third, you should see exactly why you get banned. For example, a video, reports, and other things. I was banned from changing my bio and profile picture, but I did nothing wrong. It should show what in your bio or profile picture was wrong/bad. That is all I wish. If you see this, I recommend you add these. At least the first one even.

title: Problem

review:
Tik Tok has been my escape.  I was a very carefree, carpe diem, hippie bohemian chick back in the day....when I was in my 20‚Äôs.  I have been married for 15 years and I am going through the divorce from hell.  I try to stay positive for my kids and this app has enabled me to have fun and step outside my real life stressors.
It would be awesome to be tok tok famous like my son and his gf, but Only because I think it would offer an opportunity I need right now to make extra income.  I am a little jelly of all the millennials who can ‚Äúwork‚Äù by obtaining sponsors to make a living making videos.  I want to be them.  He he.  This old broad would love to live free again in a tiny home on some land in my current town.  I would love to be a reality show and focus on videos and blogs and writing.  
This app lets the pieces of me, that exist from my past, resurface as reminders that deep down I am still fun and I can rise above whatever situation I am facing.
Thank you tik tok!!

title: TIKTOK

review:
I‚Äôm a indie-folk songwriter. I really appreciate how tik tok connects you to like minded influencers and offers a large community to engage with. However, there still be improvements. I can watch my video views plummet if I go slightly off course in content. Example: I‚Äôm passionate about equality and social justice (BLM). I make 5 posts about music getting 250 views. (Low numbers I know. Lol.) Then I make 1 post about my opinion on current events and I watch my next 5 videos about music get only 100 views, if I‚Äôm lucky. Over several weeks those views fill out, but the point is I can literally see tik tok punishing me for straying from my main content, (or having an opinion.. not sure which.)

So obviously Tik Tok has some pros and cons. But this app has a user experience that can easily surpass all other social media if Tik Tok keeps its primary focus on listening to creators and making the best possible experience for those creators. Will they do that? I sure hope so. But only time will tell.

review:
I was addicted to Tik Tok for a few months, anytime I was bored it was the first app I would go on for hours. But what I noticed is that I believed everything I saw that was put on there, I saw the horrible comments that were put out towards others, and I noticed my younger siblings and friends personality‚Äôs revolving around tik tok. I also feel like the app is made so that you keep scrolling and watch their ads AND (most importantly) to disagree or agree with others online. 
Don‚Äôt get me wrong, it‚Äôs very educational and fun to be on. However, it isn‚Äôt worth it to waste my time seeing other people get harassed or watching random people dance or learning about all these conspiracies in the world or hearing about cryptocurrencies and what not. 
I‚Äôd rather spend my time with others and focus more on my hobbies instead of being on my phone all the time. 
I only have Snapchat now which is great for communicating with friends because taking in too much social media is not healthy! 
Hope this helps anyone who might possibly agree with me or feels the desire to make a change.

review: Tiktok is an open space where people can share ideas, creations and laughter with each other on a mass scale very quickly. Tiktok however has blatant bias and it actively suppresses POC (people of color) creators. There is explicitly racist content that is left up while people who speak out against or try to bring attention to it, even jokingly, can end up shadowbanned, have their posts deleted, banned from lives PERMANENTLY and in some cases even have their accounts taken down. Tiktok is supposed to be be a safe and open space and has in many ways failed to meet its own guidelines for ALL the people who use it. Hopefully the minds behind this app that has the ability to be a tool and a vehicle that radically changes the face of social media and takes lead of it, take heed of the creators who feel their voice actively being suppressed and choose to do something about it because people are making a career and livelihood of this. Thank you
title: Tiktok isn‚Äôt all bad, but it HAS to be better

review:
Tik Tok, owned by the Beijing-based ByteDance, is a dangerous and potentially nefarious app that has the ability to steal your personal information. They also engage in censorship and extreme content moderation, which pushes content they deem friendly and suitable to the top, at the expense of minorities and that which is critical of the company or China and the Chinese Communist Party. The owners of Tik Tok have also segregated content between mainland China and that outside China, by way of an app called Douyin, which for all intents and purposes, is tik tok. This is done for the explicit purpose of stifling dissent, and ensuring the content is absolutely, 100%, Pro-China and Pro-CCP. Regardless of your own opinions about your own personal information being stolen by a company with strong ties to the Communist Chinese government, you should all be wary of a company that, instead of allowing a platform for dissent, they actively and explicitly prohibit such speech against the murderous regime in China, allowing the citizens to be only fed the state propaganda of the communist party. 

Please, if not for your own sake, but for the sake of every good person living in China and the territories it occupies, do not download or support this app or company in any way.
title: Tik Tok: You‚Äôre Privacy

title: Great

review: TikToc is built around a fine premise that works really well. However the app is run through a proxy for the Chinese Communist Party, an authoritarian regime that has no regards for human rights or privacy whatsoever. The company executives would have the public believe that it is an independent company, however recent moves by the Hong Kong based airline Cathay Pacific show that even companies based in the semiautonomous region of Hong Kong are not truly independent. How can anyone expect a company based on the Chinese mainland to be independent from the CCP. Not only does TikToc propagate CCP censors, but it does so across the entire world including North America and Europe where the freedom of speech is legally protected. Not only that, but the company collects users private data. For these reasons it is implored that TikToc is no longer supported. Delete your accounts and apps. As for an alternative look to Dubsmash, an independent platform that provides a similar service. If Dubsmash does not fit look up other alternatives. TikToc is not worth the trade off though. Do not throw away your freedoms in support of totalitarian killers for a quick video and chuckle. Take a stand for what is right, delete TikToc.

title: So Annoying

review: countless creators who are LGBTQIA+, POC, Muslim (or openly practice religions other than Christianity), and/or of other minority groups have their videos taken down or shadow banned by the app. In some cases entire accounts are deleted. Not to mention that videos speaking out on these issues are almost always deleted by the app within days of uploading. Reasons for bans are usually claims that videos or creators have "broken community guidelines," all the while white, cisgender, heterosexual, christian, and often male creators can be extremely sexually suggestive to their majority preteen audience and have their videos and accounts untouched by the app. Activism on this app is constantly shut down and shadow banned as well. This app is uplifted by the communities that it forces out of the spotlight, yet it remains popular and successful. What may seem like harmless exclusion from a lighthearted app only instills the standards of white, cis, het supremacy in the world and in the U.S.A. The way this app controls the popularity and accessibility of videos is racist, sexist, homophobic, transphobic, ableist, (the list goes on), but all of that is briefly veiled with 15-second dance videos and poorly-executed lip syncing clips.
title: shadow bans minorities

There has also been videos posted about depression, and sometimes the titles run as ‚Äúmight kill myself‚Äù, I don‚Äôt think posting your feelings on this app is very smart, putting something like that out there can be dangerous. If you need serious help, talk to a guardian, parent, teacher or even the suicidal hotline. So TikTok, it would be great if the creators could take action on some of these videos and set stronger guidelines for people, and strongly encourage negative content to be reported. This app is a good example of what actual negativity looks like.

My suggestion is; when you go to your home screen, and it asks whether you want to finish editing or quit...I believe it should have the option of saving the unfinished video to drafts. It would make it much easier, not only for me,  but others with this problem. If this is possible to do, please make this feature in the app. Although I would'nt change anything in your already great app, this would be the only thing. Thank you for reading over my review.

review: i liked this app and have been using it for a while but your moderatation system is incredibly flawed. people get away with harassment, explicit content, and even hate speech for weeks before they get caught-and often times they don't get banned they just get their content taken down or their right to comment revoked. also, tiktok doesn't even IP ban, so the people who harass other users are able to make new accounts with different usernames and come back and harass again. also, it is incredibly easy for minors to stumble across adult related content on their FYP-there is little to no content moderation. you should have a system like youtube's when certain content is flagged as 18+ and just hidden from minor's FYPs instead of your current system of (poorly) removing all the videos. any parents with kids who have this app, i would talk to them about it. i know it's 13+, but this app in its current state is probably more 16+. i would wait until they announce better content moderation & better moderators to protect children from harassment before letting a child under the age of 16 on this app.

title: Getting kicked out

review: The app is fun, but there have been some recent changes that are downright nonsensical. Recently, an option for ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt like this‚Äù was added to the report system for livestreams and videos. This is a HORRIBLE IDEA. The entire point of the open system that exists in TikTok is that if you don‚Äôt like something, you KEEP SCROLLING. If it‚Äôs really that bothersome, you can block the creator or long press the video and select the ‚ÄúNot Interested‚Äù option so you‚Äôll see less of that kind of video. Why on earth would anyone think it‚Äôs a good idea to allow people to get an account suspended or a video removed just because a viewer ‚Äúdidn‚Äôt like it‚Äù? If the livestream or video on question violated the Guildelines (doubtful), then allow it to be reported for a legitimate reason. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt like it‚Äù is never a legitimate reason to suspend or remove creators or content. I really hope TikTok will remove that option ASAP, since it means creators will be moving to other platforms for their streams. I know of at least 4 creators who have already done so.

some parts of the app are really messed up

-the music library isn‚Äôt complete, tons of songs (not just unpopular songs or new ones but full songs that‚Äôve been engrained into pop culture) are missing

-the video editing on the app itself is a little confusing and if you mess up on one part in the beginning but then do fine on the others you‚Äôd have to delete the whole video to fix that one beginning part

-sometimes the musics off

-when downloading your own videos, it keeps the watermarks on them and your name/title on the end (which I just personally think should be an optional thing :/) 

-you it won‚Äôt play songs longer than 15 seconds (atleast for me, idk if others have this exact problem) 

-when videos get taken down they rarely have an explanation to why they did, you just get a message saying basically ‚Äúthis video was taken down because it violated the community guidelines.‚Äù But it doesn‚Äôt say which guideline the video violated and it doesn‚Äôt give you any chance to truly make it up besides typing something up saying ‚Äúcheck it out again I think you messed up‚Äù which is overall a really bad way of trying to fix this 

Anyways, I love the app, it‚Äôs funny and is a meme goldmine and I‚Äôve made some friends through it and I just love the culture in my part of the app, and the whole mood is an absolute whole mood, but it has some problems that definitely need to be fixed as soon as possible.

title: incredible, but addictive

review:
I love Tiktok. It's opened my eyes to different cultures and ethnicities and lives that I never would've seen had I not gotten this app. The problem is that there's a massive problem with bigots on this app. 
Rapists, Neo-Nazis, Trump Supporters, White Supremacists, racists, Homophobes, Transphobes, Islamaphobes, Abelists, all of those disgusting people have a platform on this app and make it unsafe for normal people. 
TikTok itself, meaning its moderators and those who make the guideline decisions and staff in general, are bigots too. They regularly shadowban black creators, suppress indigenous accounts so no one can see their stuff, regularly delete tags related to social issues. The BLM and JusticeForGeorge tags were entirely cleared out- a direct attack on free speech. People that talk about these issues get their videos removed, get their accounts flagged and banned during live streams, etc- for doing nothing more than speaking out against hate. 

If you want to get this app, I won't stop you. But you should know that despite the cute dances and fun communities that exist on TikTok, you should know that there is a massive problem censorship and bigotry that comes down from the highest levels.
title: This app is a platform for BIGOTS

review: This app is fantastic in every way. It functions correctly, there are little to no errors with the software and I believe the toxicity is monitored fairly well. While all of these things are true, there is still a major issue that people are failing to recognize. This application is designed in a manner that keeps you staring at your phone all day. The developers want you to be on tik tok all day long. The more you stare at your screen, the more ads you see, the more everyone other than the user benefits. Don‚Äôt you realize that you're the product in this scenario. What‚Äôs being sold is your time. While developing the application, tik tok knew this and created an intricate AI system that curates what you like and what you‚Äôre interested in to be on your fyp. This very detail and tactic is what keeps people staring mindlessly into their phones for hours on end. None the less, the app is for the most part good other than the dances. However, I feel it is necessary that people are aware of this kind of information. Have a blessed day and thank you for reading.

review:
I love Tiktok as a platform. Its great for content and interacting with fans but the past week has been a nightmare. 99% of my videos (and videos of other users) will not upload. Whats the point of Tiktok if you cannot upload content. The videos that do upload get zero views and do not show up on my page for other users. Videos also do not download to my phone, despite having the settings on for it to do so. This glitch needs to be fixed immediately. 

On a side note, the reporting system for Tiktok also needs work. While Tiktok has attempted to remove users under the age of 13, they still abundantly exist. They report every video they don't like, and report live streams for not getting shoutouts. When a live stream gets reported, there is no option to appeal it. When my best friend went live, her stream got suspended for a week after children under the age of 15 reported it when we refused to engage in sexual acts on the live stream for them. Her attempts at contacting Tiktok to report that behavior and appeal the suspension went ignored. 

While the concept of the app is wonderful, the current execution makes it worthless.

I wish there was more concrete ways to make money(guides and exact money that can be made- I see the billon dollar vow and hope to be a part of it- not just pennies for hours of hard work)on videos and not have to be a celebrity to get noticed. review:
Sometimes.. in my most desperate times; if I feel mentally torn down, socially afraid, spiritually drained, physically weak, or uninspired. I can turn to TikTok, find someone who felt the same way .  Than found a way to overcome it and wants to share that with me! 
    I‚Äôve even yet learned the best way to use my keyboard. The absolute coolest features on my phone that I never would‚Äôve figured out. I felt like I was closer than I‚Äôve ever been to some of the largest moments in history that has unfolded this year. And been exposed to opinions outside my own bubble. That has caused personal growth. And above all else, it has passed the vibe check, and is recognized as the most impressive, most entertaining, most educational, most rewarding member of the party, and I would hit them with a hard ‚ÄúT‚Äù anyone who disagrees. This is the best app I have ever used. Thank you to the developers, and thank you to the creators.
title: It‚Äôs become a second home

review:
TikTok is my home. I go on TikTok to scream videos that people actually enjoy. We‚Äôre one huge family. I‚Äôm on TikTok everyday, it‚Äôs changed my life. I laugh, cry, smile, get upset, learn things, TikTok is special to me. Special in a way nothing else has been. If it gets banned- honestly I‚Äôd leave this as my one last thank you. My thank you to the creators and the friends I‚Äôve made. I‚Äôve met so many amazing people, made so many memories. I‚Äôll never forget the trends, the summer of 2019 when I smiled more because of this app than I have because of anything else. The unimaginable support everyone on this app gives. It‚Äôs insane. Losing TikTok would be like losing my family. I‚Äôm externally grateful for the memories. 

TikTokers if you‚Äôre reading this, thank you. Thank you for always making content that helped me through my suicidal thoughts. Through heartbreak. Through depression. Thank you. I‚Äôll never forget any of you. üíï‚úäüèº

title: my soulmate

review: TikTok is a great app, with a lot of great content made from kids/adults all around the world. It does have some curse words/slightly inappropriate videos, but you can tell TikTok you don‚Äôt like that kind of thing if you don‚Äôt. I only have two concerns about it. First, is that the For You Page only sort of listens to what you like, and mostly shows the stuff that‚Äôs ‚Äúpopular‚Äù rather than what you like. Some of the unpopular videos are like anime related things, videos from 13 or younger kids, and not funny or touching videos. I personally like anime/cosplay videos, but the fyp doesn‚Äôt. Cosplayers especially get shadow banned often, and I find it rather annoying. Also, TikTok tells me almost every day that I‚Äôm liking tiktoks too fast and need to ‚Äúslow down‚Äù when I watch every TikTok through completely before liking it, so I have to add a lot of tiktoks to my favorites, rather than just my liked which is rather annoying. However, I think it is worth getting overall, and is a good app.
title: Pretty good, with one suggestion.

review: Hey tiktok, I really hope you guys get the chance to read this because I think it‚Äôs very important. This app recently has become a very toxic place, and I feel like Tiktok has been feeding the bad and pushing out the good. Tiktok allows hateful videos of people mercilessly taunting people over ‚Äúflaws‚Äù and those videos are allowed to stay up. But a girl posts a video of embracing her insecurities and loving herself and Tiktok takes is down? How does self love violate community guidelines? Why can a skinny girl prance around in a tiny swim suit and it‚Äôs fine (no hate love yourself no matter what ladies) but a plus size girl wears a crop top and you guys feel it‚Äôs ‚Äúin violation of guidelines‚Äù? My suggestion to you is that you really sit back and take a good look at those ‚Äúguidelines.‚Äù This app was so much better but recently it‚Äôs gotten so toxic. Something needs to change. And I really hope that change can start soon. There‚Äôs so many good things about tiktok. But sometimes I wonder if what‚Äôs making it good outweighs what‚Äôs making it bad. Thank you.

title: Vids

review:
Now, I love Tiktok. The content is nice and it‚Äôs filled to the brim with different things. It truly is a great part of my lifestyle. I just think it could improve.
First, I think that the follower requirement to start a live should be: A) Brought from 1000 down to 100. Or B) Removed completely. It may really help smaller accounts get popular.
Second, I‚Äôd like to talk about duets. Sometimes, videos that have some type of joke that is best enjoyed duetted, it can lead to an abundance of duets together, know as a duet chain. And because videos on the right get harder to see with so many others, I think you should be able to scroll left and right when a video is duetted, knowing what the original/other videos were.
Third, regarding the notification log in the app should tell you if one of your videos got on the for you page. This is because I saw some comments on some videos saying ‚Äúfyp‚Äù (for you page) and I think that they should just be notified by the app. And on the topic of pages, it doesn‚Äôt quite make sense that if you post a new video, it pops up on your following list. It is unnecessary, and I think it should be removed from there.

Please note, these weren‚Äôt complaints, these were just new mechanics that I thought could be useful. I would‚Äôve given you a five star, but I felt that the things I talk about meant that this app has some manageable imperfections. Thank you.

I enjoy seeing so many videos from popular creators and just even making my own videos is so much fun. I get to get introduced to new songs and new dances that people create to go with the song and learning those dances are so much fun. But tiktok isn‚Äôt just dancing. People show off funny and crazy things they do, pets, and even be comedians. I‚Äôm just obsessed and I‚Äôm not and will not ever complain about that. This is one of my most favorite apps and I totally recommend it if you are looking for an app to create and post stuff on and just even watch other videos. Enjoy!

review: I have been using Tik Tok since around February of 2019, I love it, I‚Äôve spent countless hours being entertained, I‚Äôve learned much about different groups of people, and as someone who listens to not-so-popular-music, I appreciate being kept up on the trends. I really wish, however, that the app would allow users to block a sound. As someone who struggles with anxiety, a few of the more ‚Äúcreepy‚Äù sounds can and have sent me into anxiety related episodes thus can be difficult to recover from. I‚Äôve also seen some users upset because a certain sound reminds them of a difficult event in their life, and if they hear the popular sound once every 5 videos, it can become unbearable and difficult to use the app. I‚Äôm not sure if my mere review will ever reach the developers of the app, but I couldn‚Äôt find an email or phone number to voice my concerns, so this was my solution. title: Diverse and Friendly

review:
Let me start by saying I love TikTok the videos are amazing, fun and, so very creative. But what the real problem with this app is bullying and hatred. Creators are being harassed for making ‚Äúmistakes‚Äù, they are getting attacked with rude comments and hate speech but worst of all receiving death threats daily. These are kids getting death threats from thousands of people every day. Just imagine that for a second. review:
TikTok is super fun! Everyday there‚Äôs something new, and the content I see always makes me smile or laugh. However, my own personal experience when making and posting videos haven‚Äôt been as good as I would have hoped for when I first downloaded the app. 

As impatient and childish as it sounds of me to say, I have had a difficult time getting on the For You Page. Because of this, my content is roughly getting 1 view per video. If I were just barely starting out on an account, this would seem natural, but I‚Äôve made about 100 videos so far, with hardly any success of any kind whatsoever.

I‚Äôve been asking around, and there‚Äôs a lot of users on TikTok who are feeling the same way. I‚Äôve viewed their profiles and‚Äî just like mine‚Äî they‚Äôre getting very little to no attention on their videos. 

Maybe getting no attention the first hundred of videos you make is normal, and maybe I‚Äôm just overreacting‚Äî but I personally think that it‚Äôs difficult to enjoy making videos on TikTok, when you know what nobody will see what you create. 

The suggestion I have is that I was wondering if you guys can create a hashtag, or a challenge or something for us small tiktokers or unnoticed tiktokers that can help us gain more attention for our content. I just feel like this would help us out a lot more, and I‚Äôm sure many people would appreciate something like this. üíï

But otherwise, I really like TikTok! :)
title: Really good! However..

review: I did find this app enjoyable and fun, but I think it has to be used with caution. Adolescents may feel inclined to involve themselves in risky-behavior on the app such as, talking to strangers, using bad language, or posting sexual content. Furthermore, according to one article, ‚ÄúThese postings can lead to an increased risk of online victimization, which may result in distress or depression, delinquent behaviors, and a decrease in or ruination of future opportunities (i.e., obtaining jobs and going to college)‚Äù(Baker & White, 2010). Therefore, I think parents should review the privacy and terms and conditions with their adolescent-child so that they are not manipulated by being young and taking risks online. According to Davies (2010), adolescents who have parents who know their whereabouts, are less likely to engage in dangerous behavior. This can apply to parents being informed and through monitoring their adolescents use with this app so that they have a mutual understanding of how their child is allowed to use the app.

title: I cannot anymore

review:
To be fair, you have to have a very high IQ to understand Rick and Morty. The humor is extremely subtle, and without a solid grasp of theoretical physics most of the jokes will go over a typical viewer's head. There's also Rick's nihilistic outlook, which is deftly woven into his characterisation - his personal philosophy draws heavily from Narodnaya Volya literature, for instance. The fans understand this stuff; they have the intellectual capacity to truly appreciate the depths of these jokes, to realize that they're not just funny- they say something deep about LIFE. As a consequence people who dislike Rick and Morty truly ARE idiots- of course they wouldn't appreciate, for instance, the humour in Rick's existencial catchphrase "Wubba Lubba Dub Dub," which itself is a cryptic reference to Turgenev's Russian epic Fathers and Sons I'm smirking right now just imagining one of those addlepated simpletons scratching their heads in confusion as Dan Harmon's genius unfolds itself on their television screens. What fools... how I pity them. üòÇ
And yes by the way, I DO have a Rick and Morty tattoo. And no, you cannot see it.
It's for the ladies' eyes only- And even they have to demonstrate that they're within 5 IQ points of my own (preferably lower) beforehand.

review:
Subject: TODAY'S WORD:  Listen Closely and Follow 

Listen Closely and Follow

TODAY'S SCRIPTURE:

I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will counsel you with my loving eye on you.
Psalm 32:8

TODAY'S WORD:

Many times we don‚Äôt realize that God is speaking to us. We feel an impression on the inside, a prompting to be good to someone. That‚Äôs not random. That‚Äôs God talking to us. Or, maybe you‚Äôre in a situation where you feel an uneasiness. Something says, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not right. Stay away.‚Äù That‚Äôs not just your nerves. It‚Äôs God protecting you. Don‚Äôt ignore it, don‚Äôt talk yourself out of it; just obey. If you‚Äôll follow that still, small voice, God says He will guide you along the best path for your life. If we‚Äôre listening to His still, small voice‚Äîthe promptings, the suggestions, the alarms‚ÄîHe will save us from heartache and pain. He‚Äôll lead us into promotion and favor. Too often we feel these impressions on the inside, but we dismiss them as not making sense, or override or overanalyze them. Don‚Äôt talk yourself out of it. Just obey. Anytime you obey, a blessing will always follow.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

‚ÄúFather, thank You for loving me and for speaking to my heart. Thank You for giving me an inner ear to know right from wrong. Help me to be sensitive to Your still, small voice and hear it with clarity, to hear any alarms, promptings, and suggestions, and to be quick to obey. In Jesus‚Äô Name, Amen.‚Äù

title: Tik tok is so cool

review:
Inconsistent applications of the content moderation guidelines make it so there is a lot of troubling content on this app. Just this week I have seen copious amounts of drug usage (and when I reported these videos I was told they didn‚Äôt violate the content moderation guidelines). Other videos I have reported and have been left up include (non-educational) hate speech, anti-Semitism, racism, sexism, homophobia, copious amounts of harassment and doxing, jokes about abusing the disabled and more that I found incredibly troubling. Users who post content and comments like these are usually not punished. 
I‚Äôve also seen a lot of very good, educational content taken down. This was content that was talked about respectfully and in regards to social issues that need to be addressed.
I decided to sit down and read through the recently updated guidelines and was impressed by the amount of information they included, however it is already clear that those guidelines were simply released for show.
If your child has this app, have a talk with them, please know it is NOT a safe place and TikTok needs to be held accountable.
title: Inconsistent and unsafe for minors

The following page is the videos that people who you follow made it. You can also save a video to your camera roll or save it to watch later. You can block people and report like many apps do. You can also make your own videos. A lot of people are really nice, but if somebody comments a hate comment, if it is your video, than you could delete and report the comment. If it is a other persons video, than you could report it. I really love the community though. And the videos are so funny and creative! You can also DM and send videos to your friends ! review:
I love TikTok. It‚Äôs super addicting because there‚Äôs so much good content and real, genuine people. The music aspect is also an amazing part that social media has been sorely missing since MySpace. 

There is a lot more it could offer though. For one, I NEED the option to edit my captions. Sometimes I misspell something and I have to delete the whole post. I would also love to have the option to make the ‚Äúfollowers‚Äù number and list private. Facebook‚Äôs option to make the friend list private is probably the only thing I like about them. A ‚ÄúView As‚Äù option would also be great to take from Facebook so I can see what my account looks like to other people. A ‚Äúretweet‚Äù or ‚Äúrevine‚Äù option would also be great features. Finding friends is difficult too because people don‚Äôt use their real names. I know the app is still new compared to other social medias but I‚Äôm hoping they‚Äôll offer more options like these.

review: In spring of 2020, as a 61-year old, I was introduced to TikTok by my 70-year old sister.  I had no idea what she was referencing when she asked if I was ‚Äúon‚Äù the app. She brought it up on her phone for me to view some videos.  We laughed until we had tears running down our faces.  That did it.  I was hooked. I enjoy it so much.  I have found groups of like-minded people and I feel safe expressing my opinions.  If I get nasty responses, I am old enough to know they don‚Äôt matter to me and I just delete them.  Thank you for finding a way to keep this going.  I was incensed that it was potentially going to be banned because  the president was on the receiving end of a collaborative effort of TikTokkers.  Such a petulant response from him but it also displayed what can happen when people come together to teach an egomaniac a life lesson.  This also displayed the power of communication.  It‚Äôs just great.

review: Hi, I love TikTok and I know many others do too. I don‚Äôt have any complaints but I do have some suggestions for some updates. The first thing I would like to suggest is to be able to choose what kind of videos go on your For You Page, like dancing, anime, certain shows and movies, etc. My second suggestion is to let there be multiple accounts created with one phone number or one email. My third suggestion is that after an account hasn‚Äôt been used for over a year that the account be deleted. Next, I think that you should be notified if someone unfollows you. My fifth and final suggestion is that there should be more filters. Again, I love TikTok and I constantly go on it, especially during quarantine, because it provides great entertainment. I hope you will consider my suggestions because I do think that they could make TikTok more fun.
title: Update Ideas

review:
I actually love the content and community on TikTok. It‚Äôs funny and full of talent and interesting stuff, but I‚Äôm dying for a better way to manage and save the TikToks I‚Äôve found, love, and would like my friends to be able to browse through. 

My likes is just a gigantic singular box of all kinds of stuff and it‚Äôs become impossible to sift through. And sometimes it‚Äôs so dumb or niche that I know I‚Äôm the only one who will enjoy it which is why I‚Äôd rather not make my likes public. But an option like the saved collections feature in Instagram would work wonders. 

Your collections you could curate yourself and you could make them either public or private on a per collection basis. This way I could both organize the TikToks I like, making them easier for me to find again, and I could share those common interests with my friends/followers right on my profile as a part of a new collections tab. Algorithms are great, but this would be a nice complement.
title: Needs A Personal Curation Option

review: Really fun and addicting, but I‚Äôd recommend not exposing younger children to this app. When I first downloaded the app, it felt strange because the community was young. Over time it has become more engaging for all ages. I notice a ton of bullying in the comments section of so many videos. Comments about appearance are usually the primary form of bullying. Younger generation seems to have no sense of there being an actual human with feelings behind each video. It‚Äôs quite disheartening. I feel bad for the young children making videos and getting harassed about it. Since there‚Äôs so many young children on this app, there should be better bullying prevention actions taken. Comments section should be better filtered for hate comments and bullying. You can report comments and such, but once a child sees the comment, there‚Äôs no undoing the damage that has been done. Please teach your children to be kind to others.
title: Fun app but there is lot of bullying

review:
Reporting. Children report videos 24/7. A kid who is 8 years old can get on my lives, or watch my videos which isn‚Äôt cool. And a kid can make an account and make fun of people non stop until ‚Äúwe‚Äù report it and try to help those being bullied. 
My department training videos can get removed but a 15 year old who is barley dressed can shake her body around.
I work twice as hard as a male on this app for likes and follows, but you show skin, or generally just be an attractive female and you can have 50k followers.
Nobody understands how to get your videos viewed more, except by using trending hashtags or relevant music/audio.
Somebody can post a video of a video and get 100k likes but somebody spends an hour shooting and editing will get 500 views. I don‚Äôt blame the app for this but I think that turns a lot of people away after trying so hard.
You can‚Äôt separate you notifications which is frustrating you can over look comments, duets, or mentions. Also you can‚Äôt see duets after the fact unless you go to the persons profile who dueted you. 
You can put hours and days into your profile and get banned and lose it all. Which literally crushes people. 
But I still love this app. There are things that a lot would like to see changed but over all we enjoy the ability to be creative, and the tools that are provided. There is bad but there is also a lot of good.

review: As much as I enjoy a certain circle of the tiktok community I cannot in good conscience give this app anything more than a one star rating. Their entire protection system against those what would do harm to its community and its creators has become the actual weapon that malicious viewer on the app have weaponized. If you intend on making content on this app, assume at some point someone who has no other reason than to bully and harass you will use tiktok‚Äôs own reportin system to take the content that you have created down. If you do gain 1000 followers and gain access to their livestream system and you plan on going live, be warned, anyone who wants to harass you can anonymously report you and you could lose that ability in an instant without any form of human moderated review or appeal process. If while streaming , you have gained donations from fans and someone has reported your profile enough times to get you banned , you default all the money you have earned to tiktok. This is what you should be aware of at this point in Time using the app.

When I finally cracked down and got serious and spent time putting together a video of a painting I actually worked really hard on, it got zero views. I waited two days before I deleted it and recreated the whole video and posted it again. Nothing. I have taken that video down and recreated it and reposted it more times than I can count. Last night I decided to move on and post a different video, this time of an oil painting that took me hours. Zero views. I am so frustrated and am considering quitting Tiktok for good. review: I love this app a lot and it‚Äôs something that really relaxes me and gets my mind off of things when I need a place to breathe. One issue I‚Äôve found very common within this community, however, is something called a ‚Äúzero view‚Äù issue? Many users have reported posting videos and receiving even just a few views within the first few minutes, and then after a few weeks or days of using the app they are stuck on 0 views. It seems their videos are not ‚Äúunder review‚Äù like it usually says when there has been something unusual and suspicious in the video, but they are just not getting onto anyone‚Äôs ‚Äòfor you‚Äô page. It is upsetting because as a user you want to participate and create just like all the other people you see. If you could figure out this issue, or maybe explain why this might be happening to a lot of us, I would really appreciate it. Thank you.

review:
I LOVE the whole entire app. I think it‚Äôs a great place to relate, react, laugh, and just enjoy. The platform seems to be actually changing lives and i love how much positivity is on the app. i do have a few suggestions that could improve the app, even though i think it‚Äôs good the way it is.
Suggestion 1: Please add a feature where you can filter the videos, like select most recent video, oldest video, and most popular video. It‚Äôll be great if you can see that feature in sounds, profiles, and more.
Suggestion 2: I know this has been said a lot, but please add a dislike button on videos and comment. That way we can show the viewers that find the video/comment contains inappropriate, uncomfortable, and/or rude content.
Suggestion 3: Please add an edit feature on comments and videos. That way we could correct things that we did wrong.
Suggestion 4: On the tiktok website, please allow people to block and favorite videos and people. That way the same experience can be shared from website to app.
Suggestion 5: Can you add like a watched history? that would be helpful for people who accidentally refreshed their page and want to see the video. It might take a lot of storage but i think it‚Äôll be awesome.
Thanks to anyone who made it this far on this review. I really hope this can help!

review:
Tiktok is a very creative and fun app, but there is a difference I have found between the website and the app. The Tiktok app and the website aren‚Äôt much different, from the phone At least, but this feature really irritates me.

This is mainly about the website. First off, you can‚Äôt comment or like comments. This really annoys me when I‚Äôm trying to comment on one of my friend‚Äôs videos. 

Second off, you can‚Äôt view who you follow all that well. This isn‚Äôt much of a big deal but I‚Äôd rather not have to go through my following page to see who I have followed. It should let you show it by tapping following on the page where it shows your account, but it doesn‚Äôt on the website. 

Thirdly, you can‚Äôt search up accounts. When you go to search, it just shows a bunch of verified creators, trending songs, and commonly used hashtags. This makes it harder to find which type of content you would like.

Speaking of content, on the website, it doesn‚Äôt preference content to what you might like, it just shows trending videos. This ruins the purpose of a social media app, mainly because you can find stuff you like. But on the website of tiktok, it‚Äôs impossible.

Finally, it restricts a lot of what you can do. You can‚Äôt post, go live, view your inbox, view who follows you and who you follow. The website is also very laggy.
title: Difference Between Website and App

In return, it takes them so long to ‚Äúreview‚Äù your video that by the time it either gets taken down or if it allows people to view it again it has already gone out of the algorithm and won‚Äôt get as many likes, which prevents me from growing my page, especially when the video is getting big. Also, if they remove your video for being ‚Äúagainst guidelines‚Äù without telling you what guidelines you went against and even if you file an appeal they usually don‚Äôt change anything and still won‚Äôt tell you why it was against guidelines. In my opinion tiktok does a poor job at supporting its creators and speech is very prohibited on the app.

title: Toxic and oppressive on the voices of non white cis and het

review: Copying off of Vine‚Äôs short video format, TikTok had tremendous potential, funny content, but ultimately failed to wow me. In addition to the privacy concerns due to the app‚Äôs ownership, the user experience didn‚Äôt justify the efforts (many of the best editing effects require other apps vs being able to perfect your video entirely within the app). The Algorithm attempts to shadow ban posts that feature people who might be bullied due to their race, class, or appearance. While this may have prevented vulnerable populations from exposure, it also amplified the content made by white, skinny, straight, conventionally attractive or middle class users. The app harmed itself by preventing others from seeing the full breath of amazing content being hosted on TikTok and limiting the ability of content creators to receive recognition for their work. Amid more than a few scandals, users also complained the app was removing content featuring lgbtq+ and people of color. Ultimately there were just too many issues with this app. I may try Triller, TopIt, or Byte next (though I sincerely wish Vine was still an option)

title: Fix the problems

review:
I love Tiktok, but recently I got a notice saying that direct messages will be disabled for people under the age of sixteen. I am soon to be fifteen years old and I do not like the idea of this. Tiktok is an app that allows you to make content and share it with other. I believe TikTok videos should be able to be shared though Tiktoks direct messages. Not everyone has other social media or a phone number to share it. I believe this is unnecessary. Tiktok is supposed to be for people of the age of twelve or older, if you are allowed to have the app why should we not be able to send direct messages? I love being able to share these videos with my friends and family with Tiktoks direct messages, and I do not want to get this taken away from me. Tiktok is a fun and amazing app that should let everyone make content and be able to share content with other. I love Tiktok, but I hope you guys change the up coming policy!

Thank you for your time.
title: Direct Messages

review: I‚Äôm beyond appalled at what I‚Äôve found since joining TT recently. While there is good on the app, the bad far outweighs it. The last straw is the allowance of BLATANT PORNOGRAPHIC content. How does this NOT violate community guidelines?!?! Questionable practices going on as I reported it along with many others and while I was informed it did violate guidelines and was taken down, I find from other users that it was not so it is still showing. While I‚Äôve been prevented access leading me to believe the correct action was taken, others can. We have the receipts. Allowing lascivious, predatory, & unethical content on this app is beyond the pale. The absolute kicker here is that those who take a stand against bullying, racism, prejudices of any kind, and other malfeasances displayed on this app, especially if you‚Äôre a POC, are targeted to have their content silenced while perpetrators are given free rein. How does the media not know about this regarding such an iconic app? I‚Äôd like to say do better but that would require an investigation into the practices at this organization and I‚Äôm sure a change in leadership.

Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I love this app. There is just something that I don‚Äôt like.

Women with barley any clothes on and twerking etc..

 When I‚Äôm scrolling on the FYP (For You Page) and I see some girl with barley any clothes on, just twerking and doing other things. I hate that, then they get like 1 million or more likes on doing that. While other small Tik Tok pages try so hard but just don‚Äôt get as many likes or followers. Any parent that has a child under the age of 10 or 11 would not want their child to look at the women twerking with barley any clothes on. Yeah, you could just block/report them but that‚Äôs kind of not enough. I think the videos of women doing that, should be put under review before it gets posted.

Moderation

I think Tik Tok‚Äôs moderation system isn‚Äôt really that good. For example for what I said above this. When women are half naked and twerking etc.. those videos should be taken down or the account should be shutdown. Like I also said, videos like that should be under review before being published, by some Tik Tok moderator. If we report somebody for doing something that violates the Tik Tok guidelines, that account should get a warning or get their account taken down. 

That was my opinion on some things Tik Tok needs to improve on.

title: I love TikTok üò≠

review:
I love this app so much (as do others) but two things need to be addressed:

1. Some filters automatically make your face/lips/eyes/jaw/nose a different shape, when that is not the intended purpose. Similar to this issue, on TikTok lives, default setting have you go on lives with a filter on. This should not be the default! Please fix this.

2. I cannot express this enough‚Ä¶WE NEED A BOOKMARK ORGANIZATION FEATURE!!!! I am someone who greatly appreciates organization features. TikTok is my favorite app, so the fact that it barely has any is deeply disappointing. Any other social media app has a better organization feature for their ‚Äúbookmarks‚Äù! I mean, come on. When you bookmark something, it goes to your bookmarks, but theres no organization feature beyond that. At that point, its nothing more than your likes folder. It drives me insane! When I want to show my family a specific tiktok, I have to scroll for ages just to have a chance at finding it. It‚Äôs ridiculous! What I suggest is that you implicate a folder system. Then, when you bookmark something, you have more of a choice of where it goes. Consumers can then bookmark their desired tiktoks into categroized folders that they make. I have so many bookmarks at this point that I‚Äôll have to dedicate a whole day just to rebookmark things into folders if you implicate this method.

Thank you for your time!

Things like the ‚ÄúAhoge Challenge,‚Äù or the ‚ÄúHolocaust Challenge,‚Äù is just awful. Because there were insensitive people who chose to start things like this in the first place. People who show their body parts and do disturbing actions just for popularity and fame are often found on this app. And from what I‚Äôm hearing a lot of people seem to be insecure and feel the need to become ‚Äúpretty‚Äù like all of these people they‚Äôre watching.

title: Pretty Good! However...

review: TikTok will routinely allow racist, homophobic, abusive comments and death threats to be posted, so please beware.  There are so many amazing content creators on this app, but many are being attacked.  What they will do is create multiple accounts, so if one is banned, they have another back up.  TikTok will never ban the main account.  Also, people who get their accounts reported by these vile tolls have no true way to appeal and to speak with someone.  Creators have had their entire profile banned because someone was on the opposite side of an opinion and were offended.  Instead of scrolling past, they report the video.  As I said, there is so many amazing creators and it‚Äôs still worth having the app, however TikTok does not stand behind their own community guidelines which can make creators feel disgusted.  I would love to start my own channel, but why willing invite hate into my life.  At the end of the day, download the app, but be aware that hate is very much accepted on TikTok

title: üßö‚ú®tiktok‚ú®üßö

review:
Tiktok is my favorite app. I use it a ton, it‚Äôs very entertaining. I do have a few suggestions though. 
1. I have had TikTok since it was Musically, so I‚Äôve liked a lot of videos. But the liked videos take up so much storage. Tiktok should make an option to clear all the liked videos, so I can clear my storage. 
2. When a creator makes a sound, there should be an option to lock the sound so no one can use it. People have used sounds creators make to make fun of them, this could prevent cyber bullying. 
3. There should be an option to view the duetted videos on a creators video. For example, if a creator makes a video and asks for someone to duet it, it would be nice to be able to click and see all the duets. 
4. Auto scroll button. I‚Äôd like to be able to have the option to scroll hands free, so if I am busy I can still enjoy TikTok.
5. Links in comments. With the Black Lives Matter movement, many creators give links to petitions to sign but only one can fit in the bio. It would be very convenient to be able to put links in the comments and video captions.
6. Subtitles. I think it would be very nice for deaf and hard of hearing TikTok users to have an option to see captions on videos. It would also be helpful to people with auditory processing disorders.
title: I love TikTok

review:
This app is so incredibly entertaining‚Äîmaybe a bit too much. I know I‚Äôm not the only one who can spend hours and hours scrolling through the amazing content. Anything you‚Äôre interested in, you‚Äôll find a community for here. It truly has it all. 

That said, there are some improvements I hope the developers will implement. The biggest peeve of mine is the in-app notifications. As of now, there is no way to adjust the settings of your in app notifications. When someone you follow goes live, you get a notification. Maybe for some this is helpful, but I find it irritating. I don‚Äôt go on TikTok for live-streams but I‚Äôm constantly being told about them. There is no way to distinguish between these notices and things like new likes, comments, or mentions. I really wish we could opt out of live notifications instead of being forced to check what it is. 

Additionally, adding captions to videos is incredibly difficult. It‚Äôs not intuitive or easy, so I usually forgo it but that‚Äôs a shame because then deaf and HOH users can‚Äôt really use my content. If this process was easier, I‚Äôm sure tons of users would be very happy. 

Overall, this app is super fun and I will continue to use it. I hope the developers can find some solutions to these problems, then it will certainly be a 5 star app.

I first started on the app about two months ago and had a lot of fun making videos (genuinely a lot more fun than I had anticipated). As I kept posting, I had one video get hundreds of views/likes and it was really cool to see my content getting shared with other creators. 
So naturally, I decided to keep making and posting more videos but then my views just suddenly dropped down to only one or two views/likes (and I was averaging at least 50ish views when I started). It was at that point that I realized that for the last 5+ videos I posted, they weren‚Äôt getting shared on other people‚Äôs ‚Äòfor you‚Äô pages so no one was ever seeing my content and I couldn‚Äôt grow my account. 
I do like this app, but it‚Äôs kind of disheartening to see your stuff not getting shared so it makes me feel like there‚Äôs no point in creating videos anymore. Genuinely unsure about whether or not I‚Äôm gonna continue to use this app at this point if this persists. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

title: Great! But has some flaws....

review:
I downloaded this app a while ago, and while I see why it‚Äôs popular, there are quite a few.. issues with it that I‚Äôve experienced. Maybe they‚Äôre just my bad experiences, but they happened so frequently, it feels impossible for them to be rare.
So, first off, there‚Äôs a lot of adult content on this app. A lot. The dances are extremely sexual, and a lot of language that kids don‚Äô pay attention to that‚Äôs kind of harmful. There‚Äôs just a lot of sexual and adult content in general that kids are exposed to. I‚Äôve heard about a kid mode that keeps away things like that, but I doubt it keeps everything out. 
The chat feature caused a few issues too. I was chatting with a friends of mine when a new tab opened up, with the title ‚Äòfrom people you don‚Äôt know‚Äô. I opened it up and first thing, right up in my face, is a photo of a naked woman next to a link to a porn site. That was a fun experience.
I also kind of wish you could post stuff that‚Äôs longer than a minute, and choose where to be in the videos, because, sometimes the short length gets on my nerve, and having to watch the whole thing over again to see one single part gets on my nerves.
Those are a few of my experiences. There have been a lot more, though.
So, yeah. This app is okay. But it probably should be rated 15 or 17+. This shouldn‚Äôt be available to 12-year-olds, let alone all the EXTREMELY young kids I know who have this app.

And even with adults this feature is bad because it forces people who put actual effort into their videos off of the main page of tiktok in favor of people who pay more. I personally dont think a model like this is very good, and there shouldnt be any reason that tiktok should be going in a ‚Äúpay to win‚Äù model, unless theyre going bankrupt, but that would be a different problem alltogether, and there are other ways to solve that problem.

review:
I love tik tok, it‚Äôs a great app with very entertaining videos. Making videos is just as fun too. One thing I‚Äôve noticed is that when I make videos private (only visible to me) they‚Äôre still visible on my page. Just like drafts have a folder, private videos should have a folder too. No one would have to scroll through a bunch of videos to find a private video. Having a folder for private videos would save time and space. The folder for drafts could be shared to store the private videos. When you click on the folder you can choose whether you want to see drafts or private videos. 

Another thing that would save time and space would be having little folders for the videos in favorites. You can find what your looking for way faster by categorizing the videos into folders based on what you want to say.
title: Private videos and videos in favorites

I do use tik tok and reddit, and am aware of the ‚Äúwar‚Äù that is happening between the two apps. I see a lot of ‚Äúcreators‚Äù (people who make videos on tik tok) ideas getting stolen. For example, if one less popular person comes up with a funny skit, they would post that video and a much more popular creator would remake the video with all the same lines, and not give credit to the person who originally had the idea. But, under the random videos of sexualized dancing, there are some very good people that are very funny. Tik tok will adapt to the videos you like, and show you more just like it. That means if you can find the content you enjoy, you are set.  So I think this app is ok, and I don‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs as bad as people (Redditors) think. I would rate this a 3/5 only because under the bad people there is definitely good people.

review:
TikTok is a pretty amazing and fun app to use. I really like how you grew this app so fast! I am a certified graphic and UIUX designer and I have a few recommendations for the design: 
1- I would remove the heart on the bottom and just keep a plus or some other logo. The heart is truly running the visual hierarchy. 
2-I would also add the option to ask if you are sure to unfollow someone. I was playing around with the app, and I unfollowed people by accident thinking that the app would ask me if ‚ÄúAre you sure you want to u follow?‚Äù I would really add that in there. 
3-I would add some form of picture sharing software, Live Photo‚Äôs for example that move and activate while you score through the feed. 
4-Remove the snapping feed and stick to a free-flow. Much better trust me. 
5-I would redesign the explore/search area. Twitter has a pretty wonderful one, just an idea :) 
6-The notifications need to be heavily edited and fixed. I get notifications for people going live that I don‚Äôt even follow. Why? üòÖ
7-There are a lot of bottling softwares commenting on videos and liking. I get irrelevant comments on my videos all the time. I would be posting a video about my dog, and someone says ‚Äúlife will get easier, hang in there‚Äù WHAT? üòÖüòÖ

Other than that, the app is pretty amazing!

review:
Hello there, this is my first time writing a review. I thought it might be helpful as a user without an account to leave a review about my thoughts on the new update for settings on the app.

As someone who is not allowed to own an account, I loved having access to being able to view accounts, search for keywords and hashtags and be able to navigate the app without needing to create an account. It allowed me to be able to watch and experience the same things that my friends were able to see without needing to own an account first.

With the new update however, the ability for users without an account to effectively browse the app has been removed. We must scroll through the FYP only, cannot search for key terms, hashtags or accounts that we like, and we can‚Äôt scroll through videos on certain sounds that we like without creating an account. We must simply scroll and hope that something we like will pop up eventually. No longer can I search for the names of accounts that I enjoy the content of and scroll through their recent videos or scroll through a certain hashtag to view particular kinds of videos that I enjoy.

I did really love the app, but the new update has made it impossible for me to enjoy it anymore and I would love for the old settings to be restored. Until then, the most I can give is two stars as I can no longer use the app without an account.

This is a great app. The only con to this is a violation of privacy. ‚ÄúWe take privacy seriously‚Äù- tik tok. Not true. Tik tok takes all your private information, downloads it, and sends it to the China Gov. they download all ur drafts and scans your face whenever you download a tiktok to your photo album. They also look through ur phone and take more private information from your device. I was uncomfortable with it so I deleted the app. I had a great time with it but it‚Äôs time to take privacy seriously. Trump, our president even wants to take tiktok down in the USA. This could be a coincidence but the day after I deleted tiktok, my account was hacked on another app. This is just a heads up and I loved tik tok until I figured this out. Thank you!

title: please reach out to me

review: Tik Tok is amazing. I am busy with work, clients, books to publish, being a single father to a one year old daughter during a quarantine with no childcare, and my friends mentioned Tik Tok. The people are wonderful, talented, insightful, creative, and some are wonderful, kind, nice, especially the single parents, dads and moms. I feel blessed to have Tik Tok a part of my life during the quarantine so much so that I started writing about the individuals I have met in a book, I am a publisher, as well as invite friends and family members on Tik Tok to visit Las Vegas and Venice Beach with me as well as San Francisco when the world is over this virus. Basically, you will have fun on this app. You will be distracted from your problems with the quarantine. I hope you enjoy Tik Tok. I certainly recommend you download the app to start having fun. Thomas Chee

review:
Hi everyone 
Just a request or a suggestion:
I would you to add a notification button or section in the app
The thing is that through a the day you get many notifications of videos uploaded by people you follow
I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not the only one that can‚Äôt check every video the moment I get the notification. So the notifications get stacked up. 
When you decide to open one of those stacked notifications two things can happen: 1- if the app isn‚Äôt already opened in the background you‚Äôll end up in the main page and the notification selected won‚Äôt show up the video 2- if the app is already opened background you‚Äôll go directly to the video stated in the notification BUT all the other notifications will disappear front the Notification Center and you won‚Äôt be able to check the newly uploaded videos that you were notified about
You may suggest me to go straight to the main page (following page) and not the for you page and you may be right but I would like to select what I want to see by choice and not go through all the people I follow in order to get to the videos that I was notified about. 
I hope that I was clear enough about it. It‚Äôs not a complaint but a suggestion/request. And if you don‚Äôt agree simply discard this whole review. 
Thank You 
Regards

title: Big annoying issue

review:
In short, give us longer comments & fix your reporting/banning system.

In long,

I use Tik Tok for fun. The problem with the app is 1) the character limit on comments 2) there is no screening for reporting to someone live-streaming randomly gets shut off & banned from live until further notice just because someone makes a report. Anyone can do this at anytime and it‚Äôs not fair to creators with large followings who usually put massive time and effort into their videos 3) my feed is cluttered with people making videos about how they were banned from live or a post that did not violate guidelines was removed. Sure, some of them are likely full of it, but not everyone who has had this happen to them can be lying about it. 4) people get their account removed, as you would expect, but more often than not it seems like veterans and people with our country‚Äôs flag are the ones getting removed the most.

title: Love you tik tok

review: TikTok likes to remove videos and ban accounts when people are trying to educate people about anything that has to do with the LGBTQ+ community. They also are okay with popular creators saying that their target audiences are neo nazis or that they *are* neo nazis or white supremacists, but saying ‚ÄúI am a black man‚Äù not even saying anything about BLM they flag it as inappropriate in the application for the creators fund. A user I follow posted his screen recording providing proof of this. I follow a few queer creators who have had to recreate their accounts MULTIPLE times, and or remake videos simply because they talked about *being queer and or trans* and the experiences they go/went through. There are all kinds of videos proving that any kind of transphobic/homophobic videos are pushed more onto people FYP and anything having to do with educating people about these subjects are either not popping up at all on FYPs or they‚Äôre getting removed. So the hateful videos gain more views. TikTok is trash and it needs to change. So here I am, leaving an awful review. Do better TikTok.
title: Big old yikes

review:
My name is Meghan and I have been on and off TikTok for the past 2 ish years. For the past year I have been a sunrae(Addison Raes fandom) I‚Äôve made many friends and I‚Äôve gained lots of support. It has been amazing to grow and get so close to my dreams. But TikTok can become very toxic. If you decide to become a fanpage be prepared to get hate, hacked, and death threats. It‚Äôs hard and your grades will start to slowy slip if you let them. But honestly TikTok has helped me become stronger as a person and I‚Äôve made the best relationships on TikTok. Unfortunately all the hate got to me and very much affected my mental health and put me in a depressed state (I was medically diagnosed with depression) and now I see a therapist every week and I‚Äôm in the middle of test to see if I have ocd and or adhd. Please if things start to get bad reach out and tell someone.

            I love you and stay strong.

title: Bad videos

review:
At first, I loved this app and how creative it‚Äôs gotten! This was a place where people could share their interests and grow as a community.
However, recently, several popular Tik Tok users were revealed to be child groomers, racists, homophobes, and straight-up bullies. Instead of banning those users or blocking their toxic content, Tik Tok has no problem PROMOTING THEIR CONTENT and giving them a thriving account. Despite THOUSANDS of people reporting them for dangerous speech and actions, the reports are basically thrown away within minutes. Anybody who tries to call them out in a video, who tries to speak out against LITERAL CHILD GROOMERS, have had their videos taken down, their accounts blocked, and their other content banned almost immediately.
I no longer look forward to using this app. I don‚Äôt feel safe on it. Many wonderful, positive creators are taking a break from the app due to the toxic content. At the moment, I would NOT recommend getting this app, and would recommend staying far away until things improve.
title: NOT SAFE FOR ANYONE, ESPECIALLY NOT KIDS

review: I have LOVED being on this app! People are so supportive of one another and it is easy to block those who are not. You can quickly create a supportive system of friends and fans who have common interests.  I‚Äôm overwhelmed with attention! Other than the app deleting people at random, not allowing me to use my actual phone number, and shadowbanning cosplay and original content...I LOVE THIS APP!!! I love being able to create with the filters and editing tools or upload my own content for a longer video! I love connecting with other people and live streaming conversation! I love making duet videos and chains! This app opened a whole new world of friends to me that I would have never met otherwise. It‚Äôs my new favorite social media platform! I recommend it to anyone who struggles making friends, because it‚Äôs so easy to use and meet people! Thank you Tiktok!

You can find more 13+ content though so I recommend watching over your child if they‚Äôre very young.

title: I used to love TikTok...

review:
I personally loved this app when I had it, it is ridiculously addicting. More so than what‚Äôs healthy. 
My one problem with this app is the privacy standards. If you read all the terms of service or privacy policy, then you will see that Tiktok has the ability to collect everything you do on the ‚Äòplateform‚Äô. It can also access your phone contacts and many other things on your iPhone. The more frightening part of this is that they have the ability to share any information with any third parties (Aka anyone they want to) So everything you like, or make (drafts too), how long you watch a video, what you comment, everything you f go  can and will possibly be used against you. 
My advice: don‚Äôt download this app. Because you will get addicted. And you will make an account. And you will post. And it will come back and bite you.  
Besides from that though, it‚Äôs amazing and I would recommend it!üòÇ

title: TickTock

review: This app is by far something to consider. As silly as making 15 second videos sounds, it‚Äôs actually really fun and a great way to build up self confidence. It‚Äôs also weirdly making my depression better. Anyone young or older can have fun with this and I hope we continue to see new effects. The only reason I give 4 stars instead of 5 is because the report system is whack. I understand that there are community guidelines but I did read them and several of my videos that have not violated have been removed for no reason because it was reported. There for sure needs to be a remake of the report system but other than that this app is great in all aspects. Especially if you suffer from anxiety and depression, I‚Äôve found it helps to alleviate some of it. It‚Äôs a great way to pass time and it really does help build confidence. A+ to the creator.
